111501.name: Unfabulous
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111501.description:
Box description:

Make your day anything but Unfabulous!

Help Addie navigate the hectic halls of Rocky Road Middle School and avoid becoming popularity roadkill. Explore the world of the Unfabulous TV show, meet Addie's friends, play mini-games, and more!

boardgameintegration: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation
Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Original Series
Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation
Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Original Series
111502.description:
"Space, the final frontier...these are the voyages of the Starship Enterprise...it's continuing mission…to explore strange new worlds...to seek out new life and new civilizations...to boldly go where no one has gone before."

In Star Trek [Deck Building Game]: The Next Generation - The Next Phase – a standalone game that can also be used as an expansion for Star Trek [Deck Building Game]: The Next Generation – you are the Captain of a small Starship with a standard crew and basic weaponry. Will you use your crew's experience to improve your ships systems or to recruit more experienced crewmen to your ship? Will you form diplomatic relationships or conquer civilizations in battle? Build your deck and explore the Star Trek universe!

Play these different scenarios or create your own!


Explorations [Free For All] – Explore the universe, interact with alien races, complete missions and experience the mysteries of space. Gain knowledge and power to become a legendary Captain!



Reunification [Teams] – Team-up and determine if you are in favor of peace or war in the Alpha Quadrant! What will be the future of the Federation?



Borg Invasion II [Co-op] – "I am the Borg." This time the Borg Queen has arrived to assimilate planet Earth! Work with your fellow players to defeat the Borg and the Queen.


Integrates with:

Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation
Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Original Series
111502.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation – The Next Phase

111503.name: Tom Clancy SSN
111503.description:
Tom Clancy's SSN is a simulation of the 688i (Los Angeles-class) nuclear hunter/killer submarine. The game player is in command of USS Cheyenne in a limited war against China over the Spratly Islands. Gameplay is limited to a 15 mission single-player campaign in which the player carries out anti-submarine, anti-surface ship roles, intelligence gathering activities, and the launch of submarine based cruise missiles. Tom Clancy also wrote a book by the same name, based on this storyline.

SSN is also the title of a board wargame published by Game Designer's Workshop in 1975, and was the first attempt at a serious modern submarine and anti-submarine warfare simulation game published for the entertainment market. It was designed by Stephen Newberg and developed by Marc Miller.

Gameplay

The computer game version uses video briefings and fictional news reports to enhance the atmosphere both before and after the missions. The view during gameplay is from the perspective of an external trailing rotatable camera. In game player weapons are limited to submarine launched torpedoes, with a VLS system for launching Tomahawk missiles at off-map targets (as a mission objective). The player is provided with a simplified scanning screen display for Sonar. Thermoclines at various depths are simulated as well, affecting sonar readings and accuracy. Commands are limited to directional steering, ballast tank and periscope controls, basic sonar functions and weapons targeting and firing, providing an arcade like feel to the game play, as opposed to a true submarine command simulation.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tom Clancy's SSN", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111504.name: Frost Bite
111504.description:
User Summary

Climb the mountain to raise your flag. Your grappling hook can help you reach higher ledges or kill enemies. You can also jump on some of them. Collect items for more points.

111505.name: G-Switch
111505.description:
User Summary

Play as a runner in a sleek urban landscape. You can switch gravity by pressing x or hitting mouse click. Run as far as you can, or play with up six players on the same keyboard to see who can run the farthest.

111506.name: Galactic Invasion 20XX
111506.description:
User Summary

Shoot various enemies shapes, and try to keep them from hitting your ship. You can upgrade your weapons, and increase heath by grabbing the icons. As you lose health, the music will lose various features until it is silent.

111507.name: Battlemaster
111507.description:
User Summary

Set in a fictional fantasy context, the user chooses a leader from amongst an array of four races and classes (16 total different options) and proceeds to raise a small squad to take through a series of chained scenarios for the purposes of obliterating all opposition. Each of the four races - human, dwarf, elf and orc - seeks to conquer and/or kill all the other races, and the player's mission is to bring peace to the world by killing the leader of each race, thereby fulfilling some vague prophecy. The player can recruit up to sixteen troops using money gained in the various scenarios. These troops can be ordered into different formations, but who generally follow the leader and act as the leader does. Each troop memeber is, in all meaningful respects, a clone of the leader.

The gameplay consists of playing through the different scenarios. Each scenario involves exploring a large map from an isometric perspective centred on the leader, and scrolling in eight directions. The object of each scenario is to obtain goods hidden on the map, survive any traps, and defeat any foes. Combat consists of a singe button, mashed in real-time, which causes the leader and all the leader's followers to attack with their equiped weapons. Various items can be found in different scenarios to increase the leader's survivability and to alter and increase the damage of the leader and his or her troops' attacks.

111508.name: Magic Shot
111508.description:
A fully enclosed shooting gallery. The gun has a magnetic tip which is used to drag one of the 25 steel balls up the plastic face of the toy. Pulling the trigger pushes the ball at one of the 12 targets.
Players take turns and, after a pre-determined time limit is reached, the one with the most successful hits, wins.

111509.name: Marble Maze
111509.description:
Box says;
'A fascinating skill game for all ages: A real test of coordination'.

Each player tries to get the marble to the end of a long track without it falling into a hole. The first player to get the marble to the end, wins the game. If no-one accomplishes this, then the winner is the player who travelled furthest along the track.

This plastic maze was made with a variety of cardboard backings to make different themed mazes, For example, there was a fantasy edition with mazes like the Giant's Castle, Blood Lake, Man Eating Plants, etc. Another was themed with Outer Space tracks.

111510.name: On Target
111510.description:
The On Target game from the Milton Bradley is a big action/skill game nearly the size of the Skittle Games of the same era.
The five targets are pulled up and the wheel that holds them spun to set the value for each target. The player must then call a target (they are embossed with a Witch, a Skull & Crossbones, a Devil, a Vulture, and a Ghost) and shoot for that target using the banking corners to reach targets that aren't in front. If the target drops that score is noted and the target reset. The player may stop and take those points or may shoot for another target after they are spun again (and risk losing the points he or she just scored). First player to reach 200 wins.

111511.name: Burnout Anthology
111511.description:
User Summary

This anthology contains three games from the amazing Burnout series. They are:

Burnout 3: Takedown,
Burnout Revenge, and
Burnout Dominator.

111512.name: Platinum Hits Triple Pack
111512.description:
User Summary

This compilation includes three of Capcom's best-selling games. They are:

Dead Rising,
Lost Planet: Extreme Condition, and
Devil May Cry 4.

111513.name: American Dominoes
111513.description:
User Summary

Five Up, Draw and Block Dominoes. Single player, pass-n-play, and online multiplayer.

111514.name: Pendulum Curve Bowl
111514.description:
The Pendulum Curve Bowl game from Aurora is very, very large in the spirit of Aurora's more famous Skittle games.

Each player uses a cue to shoot a ball at the skittles at the other end of the long board. The board is curved so that you have to allow for the camber to make a successful shot.

Score is kept in exactly the same form as Ten Pin Bowling.

Like the Skittle games, this toy was hawked by a comedian, not Don Adams but Buddy Hackett.

111515.name: Clue Classic
111515.description:
User Summary

The classic detective game! In Clue, players move from room to room in a mansion to solve the mystery of: who done it, with what, and where? Players are dealt character, weapon, and location cards after the top card from each card type is secretly placed in the confidential file in the middle of the board. Players must move to a room and then make an accusation against a character saying they did it in that room with a specific weapon. The player to the left must show one of any cards accused to the accuser if in that player's hand. Through deductive reasoning each player must figure out which character, weapon, and location are in the secret file. To do this, each player must uncover what cards are in other players hands by making more and more accusations. Once a player knows what cards the other players are holding they will know what cards are in the secret file. A great game for those who enjoy reasoning and thinking things out.

111516.name: Devil May Cry: 5th Anniversary Collection
111516.description:
User Summary

This collection includes three of Capcom's great horror games.They are:

Devil May Cry,
Devil May Cry 2, and
Devil May Cry 3: Dante's Awakening.

111517.name: Reiner Knizia's ClusterMaster
111517.description:
User Summary

Rotate and place colored jewel hexes on the board. As hexes of the same color are grouped together those hexes disappear. With every cluster that disappears the minimum number of required jewels to form a cluster increases by one.

111518.name: The Rattlin' Gattlin' Shootin' Gallery
111518.description:
A Western-themed shooting/target game.
The gun barrel turns like a real Gattling gun and shoots ball bearings just as fast as you can turn the handle. It is also the most painfully loud thing I have ever heard and I can only let my son play with it for a few minutes at a time lest my head explodes like the guy in the movie Scanners.
Each turn a player can aim at four targets, scoring a point for each one 'knocked out'. The player with the most successes, wins.

111520.name: Skittle Tennis
111520.description:
Everyone knows the garden game where you have a tennis ball attached to a rope so that when you whack it, it spins around a central pole so that the other player can hit it back again. Well, this is the indoor equivalent. All made of plastic and a soft ball, you can recreate the garden game beautifully.

As usual with a new Aurora Skittle game, Don Adams (of Get Smart fame) is on the cover, but here he looks a little bored. Maybe he is thinking "I have done too many skittle games.......".

111521.name: Slick Shooter
111521.description:
A shooting target game. Mattel claimed it turned your home into a penny arcade.

The targets are reminiscent of fairground games when you can aim at targets and if you hit them, a door might open or some other result of your successful shot.

No batteries needed, the gun actually shoots a blast of air down one of five hoses based on where the gun is pointing. Ingenious!

As usual with shooting games, the highest number of successful shots after time has run out, wins the game.

By the way, this game is huge, 49 inches long.

111522.name: Snap Action Bowling
111522.description: Snap Action Bowling is a cool game by Shelcore. The bowler's arm is spring loaded and shoots a ball down the alley with great speed. The balls, brown marbles, are painted with three finger holes! Attention to detail make this a very enjoyable game.

111523.name: Spy's-a-Poppin
111523.description:
The game is huge, about 18 inches wide and 27 inches tall when assembled.

The idea is to use the Magi-Scope dart gun to shoot the spys who will blow up the girl hostage if you miss.
Access to the house is gained by shooting the bomb on the roof which causes the facade panel to fall down exposing the interior. There are two spys hiding behind the pictures on the wall and you can see them if you look through the red Magi-Scope atop the gun. When the upper picture is shot out it releases the master spy who comes down the stairs and will hit the TNT plunger and blow up the hostage if you don't shoot him before he reaches it. An amazing piece of design!

The first player to complete this sequence correctly, wins.

111524.name: Atlantis: The Lost Continent
111524.description:
Rear of Case

Fisherman's son Rodrigo finds on the beach a very special letter in a bottle. With the help of his Grandfather they quickly discover that it tells them how to find the "Lost City of Atlantis".

"People have been searching for Atlantis for Centuries with any success", said Grandfather excitedly.

Rodrifo, his dog Uzo and his Grandfather set off to find the lost city....

111525.name: Tilt 'n Roll
111525.description:
A marble maze game.

Each player tries to navigate through the maze, which has 50 holes along the route. Fall in a hole and your turn is over. The twist with this maze is that you have to turn it through 360 degrees to get to the end.

After the pre-decided time limit has run out, the winnere is the player who got furthest if nobody got to the end. Getting to the end first is an automatic win.

videogame: Broken Sword: The Shadow of the Templars
111526.name: Help Charity Compilation - 3 Legendary Games
videogamecompilation: Broken Sword: The Shadow of the Templars
111526.description:
Front of Case

Help Charity Compilation - 3 Legendary games

All profits from the Sale of Help will be donated to children's charities

111527.name: Wing-It
111527.description:
The box says "It's Fun!! It's Fast! It's the family game of the year". (a little over the top, you marketing guys).

An action game that calls for some skill. Players must knock down targets with counters that are fired from, for the want of a better word, your countercannon. The box illustrates the equipment and objective very well.

111528.name: JetRacer
111528.description:
Rear of Case

Racing over some of the biggest waves on earth, Jetracer puts you at the controls of four types of Jet watercraft, ranging from a 700cc stand up model, to an awesomely powerful 1200cc sit down machine.

Up to four players can take control over a variety of characters across four different beaches as you home yours skills in Freeride mode, go crazy trying to top your friends scores in the Extreme Trick mode and aim for gold in the Rider Championship!

111529.name: Newman Haas Racing
111529.description:
Rear of Case

Be part of a Winning Tradition in America's #1 open-wheeled Motor Sport

Real Drivers
16 individually licensed drivers including Christian Fittipaldi, Alex Zanardi, Jimmy Vasser, Scott Pruett, Robby Gordon and more.

Real Tracks
11 individually licensed tracks, modelled from surveyor's maps, including Houston (new to the 1998 circuit), Laguna Seca Raceway, The Milwaukee Mile, and Long Beach.

Intense Racing Action
Race against a field of real drivers, each possessing a unique behavior model, providing continuous challenging gameplay. Practice in a single race, test your skill in the challenge mode with increasing computer-adjusted difficulty, or compete in a full season and keep track of your points total. 4 difficulty levels for amateurs to pros.

Attention to Detail
In-game commentary from indy car champion Danny Sullivan and ESPN announcer Bobby Varsha. Authentic race sounds recorded from Newman/Haas Racing Team cars.

111530.name: Xena: Warrior Princess
111530.description:
The game begins in a beautiful place in which we see Xena and Gabrielle walking together. Xena wishes to go see a friend of hers. But at that moment she observed that the village has been plundered by pirates! Then Xena takes action in order to take revenge for the death of her friend Siras. The race culminates when she is preparing to fight the king of pirates Pactolus. During the course of this action she succeeds to save various hostages. After all this learning that her best friend abducted by Valarian's soldiers. After a fierce battle with the soldiers she reaches the King. After this Xena interrogates the King, then he turns into a Minotaur and escapes into a labyrinth! Xena after being followed found in the labyrinth of the castle,Gabrielle was captured in a room which Xena discovers situated and proceeds to kill the Minotaur. Then liberated Gabrielle. They came both in a position to fight the Amazons but for their bad luck. Gabrielle abducted again by the Amazons. Xena angrily kills all the Amazons and the Queen of them. In an effort to find Gabrielle fails, because the anticipation of a brutal witch Kalabrax which threatened to sacrifice her best friend for a New World Order that will replace the Gods. Xena replied over my dead body. Τhen the witch opened the ground and Xena fell deep in the earth. Xena at that moment had been found in close to a gateway to the Underworld but she doesn't put it below she tries to find Hades castle and she did since that only he has the power to send her the to the surface world! Hade sent her on living world. There Xena went to a village where she could find the Lyre of Orpheus which holds the secret to defeating Kalabrax. After she succeeded by battles with fanatical soldiers to find the village seer being held hostage. She finds the Lyre of Orpheus through his help and proceeds to go to the Temple of Pinnacles. After defeating the Three Sisters and Ogres that know how to get to Kalabrax she found the gate which opens after playing with the golden lyre. she founded Gabrielle and Kalabrax but Xena was late. However she defeated Kalabrax's human form and making the temple collapse to destroy her in her true form. The temple has been destroyed and Xena with Gabrielle survived by taking shelter under the statue just above the alter. And the game ends.

Source: Wikipedia, "Xena: Warrior Princess (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111531.name: Into the Forsaken Temple's Crypt
111531.description:
From the Introduction

Into the Forsaken Temple's Crypt is a short adventure for four 10th-level characters.The adventure takes place in a buried temple crypt, which has been sealed for centuries. Dungeon Masters can adjust it for higher-level characters by expanding the dead magic areas and increasing the number of power and constructs and undead that inhabit the complex.

111532.name: Hetrix
111532.description:
Find the longest link using 6 colors of gems or make the most links possible to win.

How to play:
1) Flip over and mix 84 Hetrix tiles thoroughly. Players get 5 tiles each.
2) Flip over and mix 12 link tiles thoroughly. Players get 1 tile each.
3) Everyone begins the game at the same time. Turn over the tiles and build a matrix. Do not let others see your link tile. This can be used only once in your own matrix.
4) 4 rounds are played with 5 tiles each round and points are tallied at the end of all 4 rounds.

111533.name: Pairs Up
111533.description:
An action and memory game.There are 20 pegs which fit into the board. One end of the peg indicates a shape and, when placed into the board upside down, no-one knows which shape is where. Set the timer and start drawing and looking at random pegs. You are looking to find a pair of shapes. You can only look at the pegs one at a time. Memory comes in to the game because non-matching pegs have to be placed back into the board. If you find a pair, you put both pegs at the bottom end of the board.

If the timer runs out, the pegs still in the playing area fall through their hole and inside the game, where they can be retrieved by the next player to set up his turn.

Games can be as long or short as you choose. Have one turn each or ten turns each, it is up to you. Allocate points for every pair found. When you have finished, the one with the most points, wins.

111534.name: Kingdom of the Blind
111534.description:
From the Introduction

Kingdom of the Blind is a short adventure for four 8th-level characters. The adventure is set in a minor duchy that is fairly removed from the ruler of the land. As a result, trouble can brew in the land and the king would not know immediately.

User Comment

Not to be mistaken for Call of Cthulhu's Kingdom of the Blind

111535.name: The Light of Despair
111535.description:
From the Introduction

The Light of Despair is a short adventure for four 5th-level characters. The adventure takes the characters from the high plateau of a semi-seaside community down a steep cliff and to a haunted lighthouse long disused. It is an acceptable challenge for characters of levels 4-6. It is not adaptable to lower-level characters due to the creatures involved, and higher-level characters would find it far too easy. It uses the Lighthouse map from the January 2001 Map-a-Week feature.

111536.name: Lorin's Chasm
111536.description:
From the Introduction

Lorin's Chasm is a short adventure for four 5th-level characters that takes place in the caves beneath a remote monastery devoted to the sun god, Pelor. The monastery sits atop a mountain range and has a large complex of caves beneath, most of which are used as tombs for the priests who have died there over the centuries. The monastery and the adventure can be placed easily on almost any D&D world.

111537.name: Nest of Corruption
111537.description:
From the Introduction

"Nest of Corruption" is a short D&D adventure for four 7th-level characters. The party may consist of any mix of classes. The adventure is a reasonable challenge for 6th- to 8th-level characters and may be set in any campaign world. The adventure uses the "Old Tower" map found in the October section of the Map-A-Week archive.

111538.name: Ring Board
111538.description:
Traditional Quoits game. The target has 12 hooks, worth points from 2 to 13. The rings provided are rubber.

The most points after several turns each, wins

111539.name: A Giant Ransom
111539.description:
From the Introduction

A Giant Ransom is a short adventure for four 11th-level characters. There are opportunities for diplomacy, stealth, and combat, based on the choices the PCs make, so any mix of classes is appropriate. The adventure can be set in any campaign world, in a frontier region near glacier-covered mountains.

111540.name: Sharkbait!
111540.description:
From the Introduction

Sharkbait! is a short adventure for four 5th-level characters. The adventure takes place initially in the coastal town of Mochdrev, then moves into a system of underwater caverns adopted as a temporary base by a group of sahuagin. Dungeon Masters can adjust this adventure for more powerful PCs by giving levels of cleric and ranger to the sahuagin who oppose the PCs, or by increasing the number of sahuagin. The DM could also increase the size and number of the sharks that accompany the sahuagin and assist them in their attempt to eliminate the PCs. To be particularly vicious, the DM could use dire sharks or weresharks (Monster Compendium: Monsters of Faerûn, page 92) instead of the relatively innocuous natural forms presented below.

111541.name: The Horror of Lannock Hill
111541.description:
From the Introduction

The Horror of Lannock Hill is a short adventure for four 10th-level characters. The party may consist of any mix of classes, although at least one member of the party should be capable of handling a difficult melee combat. The adventure is pretty straightforward, and it should provide a good challenge for characters from 8th to 10th level. It can be set in any campaign world.92) instead of the relatively innocuous natural forms presented below.

111542.name: Hexpert
111542.description:
User Summary:
You play as a witch, jumping between hexagon spaces. The goal is to change all spaces from blue to yellow. You most avoid snakes and other things trying to catch you.

111543.description:
From Box back:
The game is set in Teneriffa during the colonization in 16th century. In these uncertain times, you are a Spanish nobleman, trying to increase your power by directing your attendants thoughtfully. You are busy exporting Malvasian wine and building extravagant mansions while making strategic use of your merchant as well as your farmer.
But be careful! Just as you try to sabotage your rivals, they might be sending bandits your way to thwart your plans. He who is most successful at bluffing and scheming will gain the most influence and win the game!
Contents: 1 game board, 1 farm hand, 4 merchant tokens, 6 town cards, 24 character cards, 52 mansions, 1 set of game rules.
111543.name: Teneriffa
boardgamepodcastepisode: Teneriffa (Holstein-Spiele Kiel): Spiele-Podcast.de Nr. 133

111544.name: The Tower of Lore
111544.description:
From the Introduction

The Tower of Lore is a short adventure for four 8th-level characters. Nearly any mix of characters will work, but the adventure consists of four sequential encounters, so a cleric or another source of recuperative magic is extremely useful. The adventure should prove a reasonable challenge for characters from 7th to 9th level. The adventure is set in a quiet area of the Duchy of Urnst in the Greyhawk campaign setting, but can be located almost anywhere within a day’s travel of a small village. The adventure uses "The Old Tower" map from the October Map-A-Week web feature.

111545.name: The Trouble in Town
111545.description:
From the Introduction

The Trouble in Town is a short adventure for four 10th-level characters. The adventure takes place near a walled town by a shallow river with a nonfunctioning, long abandoned aqueduct. Dungeon Masters can modify the adventure to accommodate higher-level characters by giving humanoid foes more class levels and increasing the HD and/or age category of other opponents.

111546.name: Training Grounds
111546.description:
From the Introduction

Training Grounds is a short adventure for four 5th-level characters. The adventure is set in a long field in the homelands of a hobgoblin army. Training Grounds requires very little adjustment for higher-level characters. If PCs are above 10th level, adjust by adding levels to the hobgoblin opponents.

111547.name: O.K. Corral
111547.description: Each player get a random character. One card is flipped over and depending on the card and your character the players have to react with actions (or non actions). Some cards reward the fastest and some have a penalty for the slowest.

111549.name: Unknown Eagles
111549.description:
[Taken from the Introduction.]

The 1940s, as World War Two ravaged the world, were full of strife and horror. It was a time for heroes, when men and women stood to battle for what they believed in. It would be a long while before the United States was drawn into the war. A few of her citizens, who wanted to fight for one reason or another, went off to form fighting groups, risking their United States citizenship. Some went on, later in the war, to become such groups as the Fighting Tigers and the Eagle Squadrons of Britain’s Royal Air Force.

By August of 1939, the Axis started gaining chunks of the world in its conquests. Unknown Eagles is about a special group of women and men who might have formed groups of what, to some, might look like mercenaries, but who were in truth units of special agents made up to fight against the enemies of the free world.

Fighters for this secret Allied organization needed a wide range of skills, ranging from common blade combat to aircraft piloting. Eagles unit personnel went on air-to-air missions or behind enemy lines as spies. Visits back to the States would not be a source of comfort, for if they were sent back stateside, it was often to go after enemy spies, to stop whatever plots they might bring against the Allies.

Unknown Armies is a campaign setting that requires either the HERO System (4th Edition) or Fuzion to play.

111550.name: Pingu and Friends
111550.description:
Pingu and Friends Narrated by Felicity Kendal

Play and learn with Pingu and his friends in this fun and simple to use CR-ROM. Three skill levels cater for a range of abilities.

Join in the mischief and fun with Pingu and his South Pole pals!

From Rear Cover

111551.name: Forgotten Castle
111551.description:
User Summary

Enter the castle of the Hildegard's, who have long been guardians against evil. Help solve the mysteries of the castle and stop the advances towards the end of days.

111552.name: Max Damage
111552.description:
Prepare to cause mayhem and mischief as you take control of Max, an ordinary, everyday kid, except for one small, minor detail. Max has a cannon! He also loves nothing more than using it to cause as much damage as possible wherever he goes. Nothing is safe when Max is around, not even his own house! That’s right the online flash game and everyone’s favourite mischief maker are finally making their debut on iOS and they are bringing with them a whole host of new action packed surprises never before seen in the online game.

Source: The Developer Website.

111553.name: Peakwood Caverns
111553.description:
From the website
"Helm's Inn, last outpost of civilization. You hear tales of the dark and mysterious Peakwood Forest, laying under the shadow of the Ramhorn Mountains. The forest has a legend, the mysterious, forbidden Peakwood Caverns. Stories tell of Orcs hiding there, forgotten Fairy realms, Mountain Trolls, wonders of the underearth and a terrible Drakken waiting somewhere within the miles of winding tunnels. Many have set out to conquer the caverns, but have only fed the legend as none of them have returned. The Peakwood Caverns await. Are you brave and clever enough to learn it's secrets and claim it's treasures?"

Comes with 9 Handouts

111554.name: A Bard's Tale
111554.description:
From the website
"Music is magical. It can tempt the heart and beguile the mind. Some who listen too long to songs of legend set out on a journey never to return. Now, a Bard sings of the greatest legend of all, the Dragonlords. Could there still be such kings in the world, and how does their fate share your own destiny? The Bard tells quite a tale, but does not finish it. He says that is up to you, as the legend of the Crown and the Ring await you. Beyond the wilderlands, beyond the Glacier Peaks, the shadows of the past are taking shape to challenge the kings of old. Will you stand against them and become part of the legends?"

Comes with 12 Handouts

111555.name: A Fool's Errand
111555.description:
From the website
"Ah, adventure! Take me on the road away from the mundane and let me experience the world in all its glory! Welcome, brave adventurer, to the Grand Duchy of Falconbridge, and your opportunity to undertake a grand quest! A great treasure, perhaps the most valuable object in all the world awaits you, if you are wise enough to find it. Riding the length and breadth of the lands in search of clues and Keys to the Gate of Korran, at last you may pass that portal and find the treasure you seek. But beware! For Rindle the Riddling Dragon awaits you . . ."

Comes with 13 Handouts

111556.name: The Glory of Garador
111556.description:
From the website
"War is preparing. For centuries Men and monsters have fought over the legendary city of Garador, once the capital of the lands of Falconbridge. Like the tides of the sea that surround it, good and evil claim the city again and again, its glory rising and falling throughout the Ages. But now its destiny shall come full circle, and you will be caught up in the storm of war! Can you learn the secrets of this city, filled with strange magics and monsters, and hold it against the evils that beset it? Indeed, can you fight Fate and keep the city from falling again and restore its former glory?"

Comes with 10 Handouts

111557.name: Legacy of the Wizard
111557.description:
From the website
"The tale is told to children, but it is not a children's tale. The legend is laughed at by those who think themselves wise, but the wise know it is no laughing matter. Is there truth in the stories told around the fire, stories of Men who surpassed their mortality and commanded the storm? There are those that scoff at the existence of Dragons because they have never seen one, and there are those that freely jest about the Undead because they have never looked into their cold eyes. Even the most hardened and wise, those whose daring adventures have taken them to both Dragon's lair and Vampyre's tomb may be inclined to dismiss local legends of a Wizard who could master the storm of time, that is, until they find out that in time his legacy and their own are one and the same..."

Comes with 13 Handouts

111558.name: Doomspire
111558.description:
From the website
"The towering castles of evil incarnate, perched upon nameless mountains and looming over the villages below are but folklore, tales to be told on moonless nights and at harvest festival... aren't they? You would hope so, given that your road is leading into such a land, one of the wildest and least known regions of the North. And as you pass by tiny villages, and as the dark mountains rise ever higher and higher above and so cast their shadow over your road, and as black clouds obscure the moon, you continue telling yourself with quickening pace, perhaps to match your heart, that tales of the Undead are indeed only folklore, yet your heart continues to tell you something else, that this road, like all roads in this land, lead to a towering castle of evil incarnate..."

111559.name: Curse of the Iron Sword
111559.description:
From the website
"The winds of fear are blowing across the moors outside Vacelonia. This land is home to many, ruled by a wise King. His bloodline has ever shared their realm with Elves, Wizards and many other Mystics, creating a legacy steeped in magic and mystery. Yet all things move in Seasons, and twilight fell, the King’s Champion betraying him and bringing war to the land. That was long ago, and Men have used the magic of song and story to change this truth into a mere legend. But time has a way of whispering its secrets to those who can bring them back to the light. Can your band learn the truth about what happened? Can you survive the curse of the Iron Sword?"

111560.name: The King of Legends
111560.description:
From the website
"Tales are rising like a wind blown down from the mountains carrying the smell of Dragons awakening from Ages past. Rumors are spinning like dead leaves in a graveyard leaving a trail back to tombs opening after a thousand years. Sailors' yarns are rigging a thousand phantom ships sailing from beyond the world to invade the Kingdom of Roland. The magic of legends is that they define truth, but truth they are not. They are the legacy of those who control their lives rather than letting fear and rumor control them. Are you one of those who would dare to defy Death? Would you dare to seek the very heart of myths? Would you dare to seek the King of Legends?"

111561.name: Holy Knight
111561.description:
From the website
"Dark indeed are the nightmares of men, when the year grows old, the light spent, and the winds howl in the snow-capped mountains like an army of cursed men which could invade at any time. When the year is darkest, the hopes of men are at their brightest, shining like stars within their souls. Yet this also makes them the clearest targets for an evil thought to be a mere myth, the very Lord of the Night. His appearance signals the coming of an entire army of darkness, one which nobody has the earthly power to slay, save one as evil as himself, indeed a Knight whose soul he corrupted in days long lost in the darkness of myth and of legend. Can you find this fallen Knight and convince him to fight his own lord and master? Can your greatest foe become your greatest ally?"

111562.name: Swords of Twilight
111562.description:
From the website
"War evokes many powers and awakens many heroes, and fulfills many prophecies. Sometimes, like the wind, war creates itself and then destroys itself. Such is the legend of the Swords of Twilight and their Champion, the Master of the Wind. Centuries ago, these fabled blades were carried by heroes from all lands, who were destined to fight until only one remained. That Sword has now been taken by the Fallen King, whose power grows like a rising storm every day, challenging all others of power to contest him or await their doom. It is this challenge which has awakened the Swords of old, along with their new heroes who shall carry them into battle as Champions of a new Age. Gathered together by the spirits of long dead Sages and honored with bearing the Swords of Twilight, can the party find the Tower of the Wind and fell its Immortal master? Along the way, as the storm gathers strength, their foes of greater and greater power shall only temper the swords that are their souls, sharpening them like blades indeed, until in the end they will make the Master invulnerable, or defeat one said to be invincible. Which shall it be?"

111563.name: Lord of the Lost Lands
111563.description:
From the website
"The Vault of Malanthias, the Great Grey Wizard, is now the tale told at the inn. For once in every life time of Men does it open, indeed can it be found, its legendary treasure free for the taking. Yet it lies beyond the night, beyond the seas, beyond all the wisdom of Men. Its Lord is legend alone, its hoard yours alone to know, the Crown of its triumph all yours alone to claim. Can you find the Castle Malanthias in the lost land beyond the seas? Can you brave the wilderlands dividing the realms of Men and their legends? Will you find the treasure vaults of a lost lord in the lost lands none have returned from?"

111564.name: Dragonspell
111564.description:
From the website
"The land is without a King! The Lord of all Vaxxland has vanished. None can remember when, or how. It is as if the Kingdom is awakening from a dream, or a spell. Finally, a Champion has come forward to claim the throne, but he cannot wear the Crown until he has passed a challenge of virtue from every Noble who would serve him. The last and greatest challenge of all is call for Champions of his own. Indeed, are you ready to match wits with the true villains who would dethrone the greatest realm of the North? Can you through valor, battle, glory and honor discover the true enemy of the throne?"

111565.name: The Curse of Doomspire
111565.description:
From the website
"Cursed! The legendary castles of Noble Lords and Ladies were all built by a power whose shadow has taken the shape of an ancient curse, a single Lord, the master of a castle which is said to exist only in nightmares . . . or does it? You would hope so, as these Nobles wish you to find the one strongest in their blood, Lady Rachael Vandragon, whose marriage can purify them all of the darkness. Guided only by fear, folklore and a stranger whose name echoes from the depths of your nightmares, Claus Vondream, you soon find yourself on a bent road through a realm where good and evil all wear masks, where nothing is as it seems, where virtue and villainy are indeed but masks in a dream. This road ultimately leads back to its beginning, as does any circle of time and fate, or of doom, for a marriage must take place between good and evil. This marriage is the dream of Doomspire..."

111566.name: Nascar Racing 3
111566.description:
Nascar Racing 3 Takes the Pole

Take your place on the staring grid and rev up your engine for the greatest Nascar challenge of your life! Nascar series of PC racing simulation by Sierra Sports, developed by the award winning team at Papyrus. Race against the top teams and drivers from 1999 Nascar Winston Cup and Nascar Busch Series, Grand National Division, across twenty-eight authentic Nascar tracks. Featuring the most advanced Nascar physics engine ever design for a PS simulation, Nascar Racing 3 takes pole position every time!


Hi-resolution 3D graphics, supporting Direct£D and Glide (3dfx) up to 1024x768
Dynamic New engine sounds capture the roar of the 750hp engine at full throttle
Use the separate spotter and crew chief audio channel to guide you though traffic
Enhanced set-up options, including full paint-kit to customise your own car
Force feedback joystick support and internet multi-player facility


Rear of Case

111567.name: Rescue At Karadonna
111567.description:
[Taken from the Hero Games online store description.]
Can you save the prisoners?

After years of bitter internal struggle and a barely-checked alien invasion, A united Humanity liberates worlds in the Militarized Zone at a frantic pace. Your company of mostly green recruits is to jump ahead of the main force and rescue captive human settlers from a Xenovore "Camp".


Easily scaled scenario for use by any size and point-level playing group up to 12 players + GM.
12 Pre-generated characters.
Great jumping-off point for a campaign starting in the latter part of the Alien Wars (circa 2365) or as a wrap-up for campaigns set in the late-middle point of the setting.
5 maps


NOTE: This module requires the use of the Alien Wars setting book. It may be played using either the Sidekick light rules or the complete HERO System (5th Edition) rules.

111568.name: Race After 1977
111568.description:
... the year when the King last struck a chord on stage, a year of turmoil, a year of terrorism, a year when all the world powers talked about disarming, while secretly testing dozens over dozens of nuclear weapons. It was a year when the world ached for stability and the military yearned for conflict. It was a year of technical advance, a year personal computing took off towards rapid expansion. It was the year the Internet protocol was born.

1977 was a year of hope. 1977 was the last year.

Source: The Developer Website.

111569.name: Star Base Defence
111569.description:
User Summary:
You are controlling a scope on the screen, and the goal is to shoot down enemies so you protect your six star bases.

111570.name: Tomorrow's Headlines
111570.description:
Taken from the Introduction.

Welcome to Ronin Arts' Superline #1: Tomorrow's Headlines, the first in a series of adventure and rules supplements licensed under the M&M Superlink banner. The gist behind the Superline series is to present fan-oriented gaming material for M&M Superlink in a comic book format and with comic book spirit.

In this, the premier issue of the Superline series, Ronin Arts brings you four complete single-session adventures. While the adventures are designed in the spirit and at the pace of superhero comic books and cartoon episodes, the GM can easily expand each with a minimal amount of effort.

Requires Mutants & Masterminds to play.

111571.name: Cosmic Commando
111571.description:
User Summary:
You're shooting alien waves with two cannons. The cannons can run out of ammo, so you have to use them wisely.

111572.name: A Fistful of Plot Devices
111572.description:
Taken from the the Ronin Arts site and Introduction.

Superheroes spend a lot of their active time responding to crises: something goes very wrong, and they must save the day.

This 22-page PDF is a collection of ways to create a crisis, including people, places, and things that can go wrong in interesting ways. They include some (real or impending) catastrophes, and also some basically positive developments that have nightmarish potential in the wrong hands. They're each intended to provide reasons for lots of different kinds of heroes to feel like responding, suitable for use in many different campaigns. They aren't complete adventures, but open-ended starting points.

Requires Mutants & Masterminds (2nd Edition) to play.

111573.name: Lady Cruncher
111573.description:
Lady Cruncher is a madcap dash through a maze populated by robots that have run amok! Players Crunch and jump their way through complex mazes while desperately trying to outwit their enemies, who could be just around the next corner…

Arcade style fun for the entire family, Lady Cruncher is sure to be picked up time and time again!

Players can collect the keys and crunch the pellets through loads of colourful, winding levels!

They can use the ramps, jumps and moving passages to stay ahead, and need to keep an eye open for the power-ups, because they turn the hunters into the hunted!

Features:

Colourful tropical mazes
Large 3D environments to play in
Richly detailed graphics!
Great sound effects!
Play in window or full size screen
Loads of smooth scrolling, action packed levels
Perfect for the kids!

Rear of Case

111574.name: Purple Turtles
111574.description:
User Summary:
You, as a man, have to cross a lake by jumping on turtles (that are purple). Sometimes the turtles dive. The player has three lives. If he dies, then he falls into the water.

111575.name: The Treasure of Tannis
111575.description:
From the website
"Tannis. Its very name suggests a world before this one, artifacts of untold power and perilous, cunning challenges awaiting all who would dare seek vaults closed by the Angels themselves. This lost city has been known for Ages, haunting the dreams and the myth-memories of Men, calling them to perish in a vain search for its fabled artifacts. Now, however, the lost city has been found, and the King himself has given you the key to its treasure vaults. Can you cross the burning desert and find the city? Will you survive the perils lurking within the city? Are you worthy of the lost treasures of Tannis?"

111576.name: Kong (Commodore)
111576.description:
User Summary

Kong is a version of Donkey Kong for the Commodore 64 by Anirog Software in 1983. You have to climb the platforms up to the highest to rescue a girl, jumping over the barrels that Kong is rolling towards you.

111577.name: Little Storm in a Teacup
111577.description: The game consists in pouring water from a plastic jug into a colored plastic cup, trying to get a special floating dice flow with the right corner upwards before the cup is filled to the brim – the right corner being the corner with the same color as the cup.

111578.name: Ring of Power
111578.description:
User Summary:
This text adventures takes place in a distant kingdom, there a Colourful King lived. But the king went mad and was driven from the kingdom. The knowledge of where to find the Crown Jewels got lost. The goal is to become king. You have to get to the castle, and find all the "Crown Jewels", and then proclaim the Ring of Power. The game has poor pictures, and icons (sprites) of the items. Programmed by Fred J. Preston and Bob McClemont in Basic. Tagline: Search thru' the Kingdom for the mystical ring.

111579.name: Select 1
111579.description:
User Summary

A compilation of 12 games, released for Commodore 64 and ZX Spectrum. The 12 games aren't the same for the two computers.

The compilation for Commodore 64 containes:
Side 1: Hunchback, Galaxy, Mr. Wimpy, Kong, Hexpert, Ring of Power
Side 2: Skramble, Denis, Moon Buggy, Purple Turtles, Cosmic Commando, Star Base Defence

The compilation for ZX Spectrum containes:
Side 1: Hunchback, Space Intruders, Mr. Wimpy, Kong, Transversion, Missile Defence
Side 2: Pool, Denis, Moon Buggy, Spectres, Meteor Storm, Time Gate.

111580.name: Lider (Número 19 - Octubre 1990)
111580.description:
SUMARIO

EL estado de la afición
La Biblioteca de Ankh-Morpork
Consultorio de Orco Francis
Las llamadas de Cthulhu
Silencio...se juega!
Space Hulk
Flechas contra Corazas
La Jihad

El Correo del Zar
Panzerblitz

El Rincón de Europa
Indústria Aérea soviética

Plomo en las mesas
La batalla de Pidna

Dossier
Stormbringer

La voz de su Master
Consejos para la creación y manejo de Shamanes en RuneQuest
Grimorio
Cthulhu había llegado

rpgdesigner: Los Hechizeros de las Montañas del Fuego
111581.name: Lider (Número 31 - Octubre 1992)
111581.description:
El estado de la Afición
La Biblioteca de Ankh-Morpork
El Consultorio del Orco Francis
Silencio, se juega
Golpe tras golpe

Plomo en las mesas
Retinue

Dossier
Master de rol: papel de estrella
Palabra de master
La tabla definitiva

La voz de su master
Reglas de navegación
Esta ciudad es un sitio peligroso

Módulos
James Bond
Cyberpunk

111583.name: Sailor Moon
111583.description:
Sailor Moon (美少女戦士セーラームーン, Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon) is a beat 'em up arcade game developed by Angel in 1993, and ported to the Super Nintendo Entertainment System. It was translated into French in 1994. The Sega Mega Drive version was developed and published by Ma-Ba, although certain elements were recycled from the Super Famicom version.

The game is set in the first series of Sailor Moon, and the player takes control of one or two of the five heroines (Guardian Senshi). Each Senshi has some sequences of blows , three aerial attacks (neutral, moving forward/backward, downward) and a special charge-up projectile.

The game is divided into five stages:

Latin Quarter (boss: Bakene)
Amusement Park (boss: Muurido)
Secret Machine (boss: Zoisite disguised as Sailor Moon)
North Pole (boss: Kunzite)
Dark Kingdom (boss: Prince Endymion and Queen Beryl)

If the game is played on Easy Mode, only the first two stages are playable, and the ending only shows a stationary image of the Inner Senshi with Usagi as Princess Serenity from the ending scene although the music does not play at that point.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Sailor Moon video games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111584.name: seaQuest DSV
111584.description:
seaQuest DSV is a real-time simulator/strategy game depiction of the seaQuest DSV television series for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System and Mega Drive/Genesis. The player takes the role of the captain of the submarine seaQuest DSV 4600, and is tasked with carrying out a series of missions in a series of levels, divided up as "ocean quadrants". There is a Game Boy game as well, although completely different compared to the 16-bit console versions.

The game is divided into two parts; one in which you control the seaQuest in an isometric perspective overworld and are able to buy equipment and weapons and travel the ocean quadrant, and the actual horizontal scrolling shooter style missions, in which you are to achieve various objectives using a complement of mini-subs, robots, and even a trained dolphin wearing an aqua-lung. Some of the missions are simplistic and require you to make use of only one of the seaQuest's vessels, others have you make use of several of them in succession. For example, there's a mission in the first ocean quadrants where you have to rescue the crew of an exploration vessel trapped in a caved-in underwater cave, and have to use armed subs to clear several cave-ins before you can bring in the only mini-sub you have that's equipped to rescue personnel from other subs. The missions also typically involve combat between your mini-subs and the units of pirates, eco-terrorists, and other foes, but also more often than not require you to perform some sort of non-combat task such as the aforementioned rescue operation.

The other part of the game is the overworld where the player controls the seaQuest herself. These areas give you access to several menus in which you can replace lost equipment, buy new weapons for the seaQuest, and read up on the various missions you will receive while in your quadrant. While traveling your quadrant, you will also come across minefields, automated torpedo launchers and hostile submarines, many of which you need to destroy in order to achieve missions you are assigned in their area. For example, there's a mission in which you are to seal the leaks in an oil tanker sunk by ecological terrorists. In addition to accomplish this objective with your mini-subs, you need to not only complete the mission itself, but also to use the seaQuest herself to sink every terrorist submarine near the oil tanker wreck.

The game features a currency system, and awards you money for destroying enemy targets and completing objectives. The player can also lose money for destroying underwater settlements and killing animals present in some missions. Money is spent on weapons, countermeasures and mines for your seaQuest submarine, as well as replacements for lost vessels in missions. You don't need to spend money on repairs, though, as the seaQuest and her complement subs repair themselves over time.

Source: Wikipedia, "SeaQuest DSV (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111585.name: Shien's Revenge
111585.description:
Shien's Revenge is an action game released for the Super Famicom (SNES) in 1994. It is also known in Japan as -Shien- the Blade Chaser 紫炎～ザ・ブレイドチェイサー (Shien ze Bureido Cheeisaa). It was the first video game designed by the famous manga and anime artist Go Nagai.

Shien and Aska are a pair of highly-skilled ninja fighting in a bloody war. After defeating hundreds of enemies, monsters suddenly appear from the Time Gate and kidnap Aska. The mastermind is a mysterious force known only as the Undertaker. Shien must now travel through the Time Gate to defeat this unknown evil and rescue his girlfriend.

Shien's Revenge is played from a first-person viewpoint as the player aims a cursor at enemies to either throw shurikens or slash with a kunai dagger. There are six long levels, each with scaling bosses that nearly fill the screen. A set of candles indicates the Shien's life meter. Power-ups such as rapid fire and magic scrolls can be picked up by defeating enemies; the use of scrolls produces a powerful attack that damages everything on the screen. The game uses the SNES Mouse or a light gun as optional controllers and includes a password save option which allows players to continue their journey at a later time.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shien's Revenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111586.name: Sküljagger: Revolt of the Westicans
111586.description:
Sküljagger: Revolt of the Westicans is a North America-exclusive video game that was released for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System in 1992.

The Kiltish army, led by Captain Lucius Khan Sküljagger, held the island of Westica hostage; making the citizens into their slaves and ruling over them with an iron fist. For ten years, they are forced to mine for gems that made Sküljagger and his crew into rich men so that they were too content to leave the island. A young man named Storm Jaxon decides to rebel and steal Sküljagger's magical sword so that he can free the people of Westica. There is also the presence of a storybook-style, 80-page instruction manual that provides clues about secrets and hidden areas in the game.
The player must advance within a strict time limit or automatically lose a life in the process. Bubblegum permits players to fly and jump higher than normal. There is even a practice mode that allows the use of the bubblegum power-ups without the threat of enemies or bottomless pits to kill the player's character. Jewels allow for beneficial effects like adding seconds to the game clock, an extra life, extra protection against enemy attacks, and permit the usage of projectile attacks with the magical sword. Having a mask makes the player completely invincible for a short period of time; similar to the Starman in Super Mario World. Without any gems to protect the character, the game is a "one-hit, one-kill" game like Contra III: The Alien Wars. In the two-player game, each player must wait his turn before being allowed on the battlefield.

Passwords basically consists of putting words together to form sentences. Putting each word in the right order essentially opens a "warp zone" into the more advanced levels of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sküljagger: Revolt of the Westicans", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111587.name: Smart Ball
111587.description:
Smart Ball is an Action-adventure game for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, known as Jerry Boy (ジェリーボーイ) in Japan. During beta testing the original name of the game was supposed to be Jelly Bean but the title was later mistranslated into Engrish as Jerry Boy when it was released in Japan. A sequel called Jerry Boy 2 (ジェリーボーイ2) was in production, but was never actually released.

The player controls a young boy named Jerry, who was a prince and ruler of a kingdom. Jerry has been transformed into a blob by a mysterious wizard at the behest of his jealous brother, Tom, who has a crush on the young princess Emi. In that incarnation, the player plays as a little jelly bean with eyes, traveling across a photorealistic grassy landscape. The game has graphics and terrain that are characterized as cartoony and cute, which attracts younger players.

The player is able to defend Jerry or attack enemies by controlling certain physical characteristics of Jerry, such as flattening or stretching his body in order to hit enemies, or by finding objects, such as balls, to throw the enemies. The player can also run by pressing the Y button on the controller. Jerry has the ability to stick to walls and ceilings by holding down the Y button as you jump towards them, adding an advantage over Jerry's enemies. The player advances through each level along a filmstrip map, and can revisit previously-completed levels by "rewinding" the filmstrip. Each level is a romp up and down hills, jumping between platforms, and squeezing through pipes. Scattered around each level are a number of plants that open up to reveal balls, power-ups, 1ups, seeds, and jumping enhancers. Similar to Donkey Kong Country, the player must collect letters that spell JERRY in each level. Collecting them all will give the player two extra lives.

Source: Wikipedia, "Smart Ball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111588.name: Snow White: Happily Ever After
111588.description:
Players follow the further story of Snow White after the death of her stepmother, the Evil Queen. Her brother Lord Maliss, who can take the form of a dragon, changes Snow White's Prince
Snow White: Happily Ever After is a North America-exclusive video game that was released in 1994 for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System. This video game was targeted for female video game players.

Players follow the further story of Snow White after the death of her stepmother, the Evil Queen. Her brother Lord Maliss, who can take the form of a dragon, changes Snow White's PrinceCharming into an shadow monster. An entire kingdom must also be freed from Maliss' sorcery. Players can play as either Snow White or her shadow monster husband. This video game is based on the animated Filmation movie Happily Ever After; as opposed to the classic Disney film.

Fruit and stars can be collected while apples can be thrown at enemies and blocks. Players are given four continues to stop the evil Maliss. At the final stage, Maliss confronts Snow White/Shadow Man in his ultimate dragon form. Players can change the difficulty level (ranging from easy to medium to hard) if the game gets too frustrating for them. A vast array of continues allow players to restart failed games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Snow White: Happily Ever After (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111589.name: Sonic Blast Man
111589.description:
Sonic Blastman (ソニックブラストマン) is a video game franchise by Taito starred by the titular superhero, Sonic Blastman. The game originally started as an arcade game, but eventually made its way to the Super NES, with much different gameplay. Both versions received a sequel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Blast Man", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111590.name: Pidä Muumi katolla
111590.description: A simple Moomin-themed dexterity game, where players use a contraption to lift a Moomintroll disc higher and higher, inserting new pieces in the bottom of the tower. When the tower topples, everybody but the player responsible scores a point. Play until you reach the target score.

111591.name: Space Football: One on One
111591.description:
Space Football: One on One (known in Japan as Super Linear Ball) is an American football-type game that takes place in the future with two athletes playing against each other.

Using retro grav hovercrafts, these two athletes must gain possession of a hovering ball. There are twelve different drivers to choose from and the frame rate offers fast action on the field.

Features included mode 7 scrolling and MIDI-quality sound. The player moves the ball up the field by shooting it. Nintendo Power once accidentally claimed that this game was a one-player only game. However, they did correct their mistake in a future issue. Obstacles are thrown in the players way to block progress. This is to replace the lack of defenders used in an American football game played in the real world. These obstacles include magnetic flux fields that drains the player's energy and spincycles that twist the player out of control. Every background has a science fiction look to it with the stars and the space colony being shown. The goal scoring areas are similar to soccer nets but without the goalkeeper blocking it. It is assumed that each player is a quarterback, wide receiver, and defensive lineman all rolled into one person.

There is a timer announcing the number of time units left in the game. The actual gameplay resembles Faceball 2000 and Ballblazer more than the modern-day football played by the NFL. There are also elements of polo to the overall presentation as the player is not allowed to hold the ball after four seconds.

Source: Wikipedia, "Space Football: One on One", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111592.name: Dungeon Maker: Hunting Ground
111592.description:
User Summary

The player creates a dungeon to lure monsters inside. They then fight the monsters to gain money and items to allow them to build deeper dungeons and fight more effectively. Repeat this process to build floor after floor of dungeon, fighting increasingly tough monsters and bosses.

111593.name: Dungeon Maker II: The Hidden War
111593.description:
User Summary

In this sequel to Dungeon Maker: Hunting Ground, the player once again builds a dungeon to lure in a wide variety of monsters. The player then enters their created dungeon and battles their way through. By collecting items and money from defeated monsters and bosses the player buys additional rooms and hallways to build deeper and deeper dungeon floors.

111600.name: A Dish Best Served Cold
111600.description:
From publisher blurb:

UNITAS was supposed to be the ultimate intelligence agency, working at the direction of the world community and dedicated to providing world stability. But what if the enemy was the global community itself? Project Deadline hopes to correct the situation, working in secrecy with terribly limited resources. This is the first module dealing with the revelations of Robbing Peter, but may be played independently.

111601.name: Mission Conversion: A Routine Operation
111601.description:
User summary:

Conversion notes for playing A Routine Operation with Spycraft 2.0 rules.

111602.name: Mission Conversion: Agent Down
111602.description:
User summary:

Conversion notes for playing Agent Down with Spycraft 2.0 rules.

111603.name: Mission Conversion: Black Tie Formal
111603.description:
User summary:

Conversion notes for playing Black Tie Formal with Spycraft 2.0 rules.

111604.name: Mission Conversion: The Condemned
111604.description:
User summary:

Conversion notes for playing The Condemned with Spycraft 2.0 rules.

111605.name: Mission Conversion: The Maltese Experiment
111605.description:
User summary:

Conversion notes for playing The Maltese Experiment with Spycraft 2.0 rules.

111606.name: Double Tap
111606.description:
From publisher blurb:

This mission’s plot revolves around the acquisition of a briefcase, the contents of which are unknown and ultimately irrelevant. It’s literally a McGuffin device, used to introduce the idea of The System.

The agents are tasked by their handler Firefox to travel to Sydney, Australia to retrieve the briefcase from the latest owner, a former B-grade Hollywood actor named Henry Davenport. Davenport had recently won a string of long shot bets, and the briefcase is suspected to somehow play a part in his good fortune.

However, the players are the second UNITAS retrieval team. Alexi Pachirakov (Codename Magi) was initially tasked, but contact had been lost a few days into his mission. Now with the recent death of several contacts associated with Magi, it’s assumed that he had either been captured or gone rogue. The agents have a secondary mission of bringing Pachirakov in for debriefing, or to terminate him with extreme prejudice.

To further complicate things, another team of agents is on the board. Tranquility Six, a freelance team for hire, is also on the hunt for the briefcase.

111607.name: Dr. M
111607.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cold War may be over, but there are those who wish the outcome were different. UNITAS discovers that someone isn't content with the current world situation and the Canadian Arctic has clues to the person's identity. Do you have what it takes to stop a madman's plot to rekindle the flames of the Cold War?

111616.name: Murderous Ghosts Player Book
111616.description:
From the publisher's website:

2 players, 20-60 minutes, intense horror.

Can you escape from the murderous ghosts?

(Hint: probably not.)

Play your book and your wits against the GM’s book and her twisted, murderous, bloody imagination.

111617.description:
"Mephisto" is a symbiotic alien creature brought to Earth about 65 million years ago by a meteorite. It has grown since then from a small spawn to a net of interconnected, specialized grubs, reaching from Australia to the North Pole through both Americas. Now in the year 2050, the war on the surface above is blazing and furious like it was never before. Mephisto, slow as it is, has noticed that something on the surface wants to harm it and decides to participate in the war to defend itself.

Neuroshima Hex! Mephisto started life as a fan-created army expansion for Neuroshima Hex!, one published in small numbers by Portal Games as an exclusive gift for loyal NH fans, but in 2013 Portal Games announced that it had developed Mephisto and would now release it as an official expansion.
111617.name: Neuroshima Hex! Mephisto
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

111618.name: Lights Out
111618.description:
From publisher blurb:

When an energy scientist frequently disappears from his cell at an asylum, a team is sent to investigate. Part Two of the Cossack Effect series but may be played independently.

111619.name: Mission Pack: Code Red
111619.description:
From publisher blurb:

A plan to assassinate the Crown Prince of England has been discovered. It is up to you to find out who, and why, and then stop it from happening.

111620.name: Mission Pack: Jungle Fever
111620.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a man stumbles out of the Amazon Rainforest, says the name of a former Soviet chemical weapons scientist, then dies from an unknown chemical agent, UNITAS must act quickly to deal with the threat. But more than the scientist awaits the agents as they must face guerrillas, the elements, a carefully guarded fortress, deadly chemical weapons, and the jungle itself.

111621.name: Get Off My Lawn
111621.description:
User Summary

Try to keep the Mollets from eating your lawn, by running them over with your lawnmower. Upgrade your lawnmower in several categories such as it's speed and damage, and buy a number of other helpful items to assist you in keeping your beautiful lawn.

111622.name: Gliding Thunder
111622.description:
User Summary

Control a highly weaponized hovercraft. You have three weapons, a machine gun with a high rate of fire that can overheat and jam, rockets, and time bombs. Use them all wisely to defeat the enemies in each stage.

111624.name: Goblins Heart
111624.description:
User Summary

Fight off Goblins as you roam the land. Upgrade your armor, sword, hit points and other attributes with money earned. You can attack, block and sword attack.

111625.name: Cribbage Premium
111625.description:
User Summary

Electronic version of the classic game Cribbage.

111626.name: Reiner Knizia's Modern Art: The Card Game
111626.description:
User Summary

Electronic version of Reiner Knizia's Modern Art: The Card Game.

111627.name: Pirate's Battle
111627.description:
User Summary

Arcade style nautical battle game. Steer your ship and fire on the enemy's ship until one is sunk.

111628.name: Reign Of Swords: Episode II
111628.description:
User Summary

Turn Based Strategy Game for the iPhone

111629.name: Scrabble Journey
111629.description:
User Summary

Solitaire Scrabble Game. Build your Scrabble crossword from one end of the map to the other.

videogame: Need for Speed III: Hot Pursuit
111630.name: Family MegaHits II
videogamecompilation: Need for Speed III: Hot Pursuit
111630.description:
User Summary

This collection includes four top games. They are:
Need for Speed III: Hot Pursuit,
Railroad Tycoon II,
Titanic Adventure Out of Time, and
You Don't Know Jack Television.

111631.name: Accolade: Journey to Knighthood
111631.description:
In Accolade each player takes on the role of the Lord of a medieval household. The players must guide four Squires on their journey around the board on their quest to become Knights and garner influence for their household. During their journey, they will also be attempting to keep the rival households in check. Can you be the most influential Lord and gain the ear of the King? Only time will tell.

Inspired by classic games such as Parcheesi/Ludo and Checkers/Draughts, Accolade is an abstract game of chance and strategy, which has players maneuver their Squires around the exterior path of the board in an attempt to reach their home cathedral (similar to Parcheesi). Once the Squire makes it to the cathedral, he receives his Accolade and is knighted. This new Knight now reenters the board, now with the sole goal of interfering with your opponent's Squires and Knights.

The board is made up of a central hub and 4 spokes, which are assembled differently depending on the number of players (2-4), allowing for a scalable game that decreases the amount of dead time experienced in a 2 player game of Parcheesi/Ludo. Though the board could also be used as an alternate Parcheesi board using those standard rules (and there is a bonus draughts board on the back of the main hub as well).

The main mechanic of the game is simple dice rolling for movement in a similar style to Parcheesi, but the pieces have more options on what they can do with those rolls. Opposing pawns (Squires/Knights) interact with each other by Checking (landing on them, as in Parcheesi) or Capturing (jumping over, as in Checkers) them. Pawns can attain a degree of safety by being in Castle spaces, or forming a Castle by doubling up 2 pawns of the same color.

Points (influence) are scored for removing opposing Squire / Knights and for any of your own Knights on the board (not in your home area).

The game ends once all remaining pawns are Knights, then the player with the most points (influence) gains the ear of the King and is considered the winner.

The game was created as an entry for TGC Classic Game Mashup Contest.

111632.name: German Eagle vs. Russian Bear
111632.description:
From the application's "About" file

This is a classic hex and counter wargame converted for Android.

There is a map of Easter Europe divided into hexes.

Each hex can be controlled by one of two players: One player represents the Axis forces, while the other represents the Soviet. Each player has a number of combat formations (units) which they may move around the map in an attempt to win the war.

German Eagle vs. Russian Bear: A [FREE] World War II Russian Front Boardgame [War Game] Kit (indexed on Educational Resources Information Center as ERIC Document no. ED361256, Copyright 1993 Louise R. Coatney)

A Note on Copyright: GERMAN EAGLE VS. RUSSIAN BEAR is COPYRIGHTED -- NOT Public Domain -- and FREE under the following conditions: Schools, libraries, and museums are free to make and keep copies for in-house educational use or nonpermanent loan/circulation.

An individual is free to make one personal copy of GERMAN EAGLE VS. RUSSIAN BEAR for his/her own personal use. All other rights -- including publishing rights -- are reserved to Lou Coatney.

Android version by Dave Kershaw 2011.

111634.name: Mäusejagd mit Kater Kralle
111634.description:
Objective: Try to protect all your mice - put them into a safe hideout.
'Kater Kralle' (cat Claw) is busy with hunting mice and tries to imprison them. Only those who can hide themselves below the turning 'cheese wheel' are safe.
The first player who can protect all his/her mice wins the game.
Content:
1 'cheese wheel' (board)
18 mice
1 'Kater Kralle'
4 prisons
1 wooden die (with symbols)
1 rule sheet

111635.name: Calciotto
111635.description: Calciotto is a football-themed board game with eight footballers on each team. Organize your team according to your tactical choices placing on the field the best players to try to win the match! Exploit the football player's strength or his quickness and help yourself through the calciotto cards to defeat the adversary! Try to understand your adversary's tactics contrasting it even with proper replacements. So with "CALCIOTTO zonAction" you can play as a football player or as a trainer.

111636.name: Azuleo
111636.description:
Objective: Try to form as many valuable colour combinations as possible
Azuleo has its origin from the Portuguese word „azulejo“ for „tile“.
Starting the game a player draws/places two tiles (crosses) which determine the colour-combinations you can score. During your turn you should place a tile out of your personal supply (max. 2) which fits into. The allowed combination shows a square consisting of max. two colours.
You may change the colour tiles for other combinations, too and you can also score points for placing blockade crosses where no colour cross can fit.

111637.name: Batt
111637.description:
Taken from the Publisher's website:

it is a card game for 2, 3, 4 players. Form your Tribe and start your battle facing the attacks of wolves, buffalos and eagles that your adversaries will try to throw on you! The challenge starts!
You must do more points than your adversaries forming one or more patrols built with your own cards. The player who first arrives to 100 points wins. The points are obtained by the red ability spheres at the base of the tribe cards or of the passive defense cards (1 ability sphere = 1 point).

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 90 playing cards.

111638.name: Calcetto
111638.description:
Taken from the Publisher's Website

It is a boardgame for 2 players that defy each other forming their team composed of 5 elements each one with different abilities of contrast/shot, with the aiming of score more goals than the adversary. Every player puts his players onto the field according to his tactical choices and makes the actions trying to get free from marking the adversary and to shoot at goal.

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 1 game board (the football field); 20 cardboard shapes (the 2 teams); 20 little plastic bases; 6 cardboards balls; 1 ball (plastic pawn); 2 dice (1-6); 1 plus/minus dice (+/-).

111639.name: KARMOX caccia al tesoro
111639.description:
From the publisher's website:

8 brave heroes fight for the treasure of Karmox fortress. Only one will be the winner! Choose your character or your team to start your treasure hunting; the characters increase their level during the game defeating the adversaries; from the life points of the adversaries one gets the level points that will then be transformed into ability points used to increase the player's attack or defense or movement. Exploit the "event" chart that will allow you also to call for the "warrior spirit" that will help you during the most critical moments.

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 1 modular game board; 60 pawns to score points; 1 red pawn; 1 blue pawn; 2 6-sided dice; 8 "warrior spirit" cards; 1 "event" mini game board; 8 character charts; 8 characters (cardboard shapes); 8 coffers (cardboard shapes); 16 little plastic bases (to keep the cardboard shapes)

111640.name: Ungeheuer Indiskret
111640.description:
Objective: try to understand the thoughts of the other players
- collect as many (matching) chips as possible.
Within of many dragons dominated (illustrated) Europe (map) you see very nice & cute drawings all over the board.
The players try to be right with their guesses about the linkage of attributes and drawings.
Example:
The two adjectives 'enviable' and 'fiery' can be related to
'Flamenco' in Spain or to a 'love couple' image in Denmark.
If you match the active player's decision you score (chips).

111641.name: 5star
111641.description:
5star is a racing game for 2 players in which the number 5 on the dice serves to allow new stars onto the board. After this it's a race to the finish. The first player to get 5 stars over the finish line is the winner. Stars can be captured by both your own stars as well as by opponent stars. Whenever a star is on the fifth or tenth position on the track, it's prone to capture the oppenent if he/she moves a star to the same rank.

Multiple games can be combined to allow for more than 2 players.

5star is designed by the mother-and-daughters trio Linda, Isis and Nova.

111642.name: Young & Fashion
111642.description:
Objective:
Replay of the economical stuff learned on middle school
game ends after 90 min ==> winner: most points/money

Economic & educational game (simulation of a company producing
teenage furniture)
Check - if pupils have learned economic stuff successfully
- moving/acting by turn -

players roll the die, move their meeples; if you land on a marked area draw a card:
cards have questions coming out from
a. calculation (cash discount, credits, stocks...)
b. accounting (different business cases)
c. cost-benefit analysis
d. economic analysis / spreadsheets
solving these questions takes time, because most often you have
to find a problem-solving approach, subsequently to calculate getting correct result
collecting bonus points/money to get awarded

111644.description:
DKT, das kaufmännische Talent, is an Austrian equivalent for the well-known "Monopoly".

Your object is not to be the last still in play, but to be the first to pay back your debts and thus win the game. Players start with 2000 units of money and choose 1 to 3 start actions, depending on the number of players, either buying a plot of land or taking out a loan. Player rolls the die - first he moves a tourist marker and implements the spot reached for him. Then he moves his own marker and implements the game reached - special spots or buying, building, paying rent or either paying back a loan or taking out an additional loan.

In this dynamic version there are a few major changes, which make for interesting decisions and the game quicker:
You move two tourists with a third die.
To win the game, you have to pay back your starting money.
