Its appearance when attached resembles the nunchaku, hence the name. It features an analog stick similar to the one found on the GameCube controller and two trigger buttons. It works in tandem with the main controller in many games. Like the Wii Remote, the Nunchuk also provides a three-axis accelerometer for motion-sensing and tilting, but without a speaker, a rumble function, or a pointer function.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wii Remote," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111745.name: War Front: Turning Point
111745.description:
The game is set in an alternate World War II in which Adolf Hitler is assassinated in the early days of the war and under the new chancellor, Germany occupies Great Britain. Eventually, Nazi Germany is defeated, but this allows the Soviet Union to advance into Western Europe. The game features both real life and fictional "experimental" war machines and units.

Source: Wikipedia, "War Front Turning Point", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111747.name: Atelier Totori: The Adventurer of Arland
111747.description:
The small fishing village of Alanya on the Arland Republic's southern border is home to the young alchemist-in-training Totooria Helmold. She is called Totori by her friends and family, and she wishes to become a great adventurer. One day, she resolves to make the journey to Arland, become an adventurer, and explore the world beyond her hometown. She will make many friends along her journey of discovery — some new, some familiar. When her quest comes to a close, your actions over the course of the game will dictate whether she finds the answers to her questions, forge unbreakable bonds with friends, or take different paths entirely.

Source: The Publisher Website.

111748.name: Veni Vidi Vici
111748.description: A Chess-like move and capture game played on an 8 x 8 board which includes terrain, which enables ambushes, has swamps to avoid and forts into which retreats may be conducted, but which may also be besieged.

111749.name: A Windy Day
111749.description:
User Summary

Control a paper plane by using your mouse to blow air from above or below, using 'wind power'.

Avoid obstacles such as trees and birds and aim to pop balloons to increase your score and also replenish your 'wind power'.

videogamefranchise: Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
111750.description:
When a man has won all his battles and defeated his enemies; what is left for him to achieve? Ezio Auditore must leave his life behind in search of answers, in search of the truth.
In Assassin's Creed® Revelations, master assassin Ezio Auditore walks in the footsteps of the legendary mentor Altaïr, on a journey of discovery and revelation. It is a perilous path – one that will take Ezio to Constantinople, the heart of the Ottoman Empire, where a growing army of Templars threatens to destabilise the region.

In addition to Ezio's award-winning story, a refined and expanded online multiplayer experience returns with new and additional modes, maps, and characters, allowing you to test your assassin skills against others from around the world.

>> KEY FEATURES
BECOME DEADLIER THAN EVER –Take on the lethal skills of a wiser, more efficient and deadlier Ezio. Swiftly eliminate your adversaries by deploying a new arsenal of weapons and abilities, such as enhanced free-running and hook blade combat. Experience new levels of gameplay customisation with bomb crafting, and use heightened Eagle Vision to overcome your enemies and the environment.

TEST YOUR SKILLS AGAINST THE BEST – A critically acclaimed multiplayer experience gets even better, with all-new team modes and unlimited replay value.

EXPERIENCE REVOLUTIONARY GAMEPLAY – Explore the farthest reaches of the Animus as you uncover the mysteries of Desmond’s past while gaining insight into what the future might hold.

Source: The Game Website.
videogamehonor: 2011 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2011 Spike Best Action Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2012 CVA Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2012 CVA Best Canadian-Made Game of the Year Nominee
2012 CVA Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2012 CVA Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2012 CVA Best Narration of the Year Nominee
2012 CVA Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2012 CVA Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2012 CVA Best Visual Arts of the Year Winner
2012 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee
111750.name: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
videogameexpansion: Assassin's Creed: Revelations – The Lost Archive

111751.name: Clones
111751.description:
User Summary

Clones is a puzzle game with elements similar to Lemmings, requiring players to guide their forever-marching group of Clones to the exit using a variety of different skills. The game has a number of different game modes, including a team-multiplayer mode for up to 16 players, and a level editor. Custom levels can be shared online and downloaded by other players.

111752.name: Rayman Origins
videogamehonor: 2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2012 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2012 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Best Video Game Visuals/Artwork Nominee
111752.description:
Rayman is back!
Fifteen years after the first Rayman® game launched worldwide, Michel Ancel (celebrated creator of this limbless yet limitless hero) returns to his roots to revive the fun with one of platforming’s most iconic characters. This time, Rayman is joined by his friend Globox and two Teensies for 60 levels of immersive 2D platforming adventure in full HD graphics, featuring 4-player, jump-in/jump-out co-op; all running at 60 fps!

Enter the Glade of Dreams.
A gorgeously designed interactive cartoon playground populated by strange and hilarious creatures in eye-popping environments. When the Glade of Dreams is overrun by “nefurrious” Darktoons, the Fairy Council hastily invokes Rayman to save the day; but the hero of light isn’t quite all there… To help him, Rayman teams up with his best friend, Globox, and two crafty wizards, the Teensies. Together they form the world’s most hilarious team of heroes, and they’ll need to join forces to restore peace to the Glade or watch as their beloved home vanishes like a bad dream…

Source: The Game Website.

111753.name: Just Dance 3
videogameversion: North American Wii Best Buy edition
North American Xbox 360 Best Buy edition
videogamehonor: 2012 CVA Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee
111753.description:
JUST DANCE IS BACK & BETTER THAN EVER
join the world’s biggest party ever! stand up and dance with your friends to chart-topping tracks from pop, rock, dance, r’n b…

NEW MODES, MORE CHALLENGE, MORE FUN
play all your favourites modes and dance to the new 4 player dance crew mode where everyone has their own moment in the spotlight with a specific choreography!

STAY FIT WHILE HAVING FUN
the "just sweat" mode has been improved! choose your program, workout and monitor your performance on the just sweat dashboard.

CHOOSE A PLAYLIST THAT FITS THE MOMENT
get the party started with the right tune. select one of the 13 playlists available such as 80’s, pop! pop!, sweat attack, oldies but goldies, and show off your moves.

THE MORE YOU DANCE, THE MORE YOU GET
improve your performance and accumulate the stars to unlock up to 30 song modes such as dance mash-up versions, fitness version… moreover, the more friends you play with, the more stars you get!

Source: The Game Website.

111754.name: Raving Rabbids: Alive & Kicking
111754.description:
They’ve invaded TV, they’ve gone to the moon and even blundered through history. Now the Rabbids are back with a plan even more raving than usual: to invade players’ everyday lives! From their ever-so-secret underground base, they are drawing up plans that will allow them to conquer the world of humans. With the help of the Mighty Mad Scientist, the Grand Master Chief Rabbid has discovered how to create a massive Rabbid army. The invasion has only just begun, and the Rabbids are spreading throughout the city faster than you can say Bwaaah!

Source: The Game Website.

111755.name: Far Cry 3
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
videogamehonor: 2012 EGM Game of the Year Winner
2012 Gamescom Best of Gamescom Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Villain of the Year Winner
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Action Game of the Year Winner
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2013 CVA Best Animation of the Year Winner
2013 CVA Best Canadian-Made Game of the Year Winner
2013 CVA Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2013 CVA Best Game Design of the Year Winner
2013 CVA Best Game Innovation of the Year Winner
2013 CVA Best Narration of the Year Nominee
2013 CVA Best Visual Arts of the Year Winner
2013 CVA Game of the Year Winner
2013 D.I.C.E. Action Game of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Technology of the Year Winner
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee
2013 Global Game Awards Best Open World Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Global Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Best Video Game Visuals/Artwork Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Video Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Golden Joystick Best Gaming Moment Winner
2016 Steam Awards Villain Most In Need Of A Hug Nominee
videogamecompilation: Far Cry 3 + Far Cry 4 Double Pack
111755.description:
Beyond the limits of civilization lies an island, a lawless place ruled by piracy and human misery, where your only escapes are drugs or the muzzle of a gun. This is where you find yourself, trapped in a place that’s forgotten right from wrong, a place that lives by the principles of violence. Discover the island’s bloody secrets and take the fight to the enemy; improvise and use your environment to survive. Beware the beauty and mystery of this unexplored paradise and live to outwit its roster of ruthless, desperate characters.
You’ll need more than luck to survive.

Source: The Game Website.

111756.name: The Eye (Issue 3 - Q3 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Eclipse Phase vs Mass Effect - Biotics
111756.description: The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

111757.name: The Game of the Red Pig
111757.description:
Game circa 1930's from Parker Brothers.

This is sort of a spin and move game where depending on what number you get from the spinner you move forward that number of places on the board. There are certain places on the board with special letters on them. Those spaces allow you to move forward extra spaces. Landing on places with Black dots make you move back some number of spaces. First to finish wins!

111758.name: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Future Soldier
111758.description:
The story will take place in a near future in Norway, the Middle East, and Asia where Russia went into war. The Ghosts will be fighting an ultra-nationalist force that took control of Russia and are invading neighboring countries on the deadliest missions behind enemy lines. The player will take control of a 4-man Ghost team consisting of a commando (Kozak), a sniper expert (Pepper), a reconnaissance expert (30k), and an engineer (Bones). The Wii and PSP versions have different storylines.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Future Soldier", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111759.name: The Great City Game: Paris
111759.description:
Box says: Explore the great city of Paris from the comfort of your home. A strategy-travel game, for 2-6 players. #7471, 1974 Gameophiles Unlimited, Inc. 16 Pine St., Morristown, NJ 07960. Patent Pending.

Roll the die and move. Land on special squares and pick cards that move you to different places like the Louvres Museum or the Eiffel Tower, Arch of Triumph, Church of Sacre Couer etc. Enter the city from Orly Airport, The Palace at Versailles, Longchamps or Colombey. See the needed number of places in the city to win the game.

111760.name: Gun Express
111760.description:
User Summary

You are a courier, delivering highly sensitive items.
You're driving a heavily weaponized motorcycle, trying to clear levels as quickly as possible along while destroying other motorists, all for points and extra time.

111761.name: Gun Mayhem
111761.description:
User Summary

Try to shoot your opponents off the platform, while staying on the platform yourself. There are a large number of weapons, and bonus items to get, and many levels to explore. Play co-op with a friend, or with AI. You can play up to four human players at once. There is also a single player campaign mode, and several modes with varying rules.

111762.name: Guderian
111762.description:
User Summary

Simulates the critical Smolensk campaign of World War II. At your command are infantry divisions panzer regiments, motorized infantry, panzer grenadiers, etc. By James Dunnigan

111763.name: H.E.L.I.C.
111763.description:
User Summary

An interesting mix of genres. You control a helicopter, and must shoot enemy units, but these enemy units follow a path like a tower defense game, and you can buy additional defenses like this genre. However these units will be damaged in the battle, and your helicopter can repair them. Repair the helicopter itself with first aid kit.

111764.name: The Eye (Issue 4 - Q4 2011)
rpgissuearticle: From all of us, thank you!
Guillaume de la Mer - Uplift Artist
111764.description: The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

111765.name: Elder Sign: Omens
videogamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
111765.description:
Elder Sign: Omens is an application for your digital device that delivers the tense excitement of Richard Launius and Kevin Wilson’s popular dice game to an all-new digital medium. Its detailed instructional resources and intuitive interface will have you investigating in minutes, while its deep and engaging gameplay provides countless hours of eldritch horror.

Note: while Elder Sign: Omens brilliantly conveys the spirit of the Elder Sign dice game, a few noteworthy differences were adopted to optimize the mobile play experience:


Arguably the most powerful Ancient One in Lovecraft’s Mythos, Azathoth’s awesome power is indisputable. This infinitely destructive deity is therefore the focal point of Elder Sign: Omens, and the only available Ancient One.
A number of subtle changes increase the peril of defending humanity. For example, the random negative effects drawn every midnight are more challenging, and the frequency of "no effect" results has been decreased. Monsters have likewise been altered to make them more difficult.
Finally, there are no Ally cards in Elder Sign: Omens, which further streamlines play while increasing the overall challenge.


Can you stand against the impending arrival of Azathoth?

Source: The Publisher Website.

111766.name: ZOMBIES!  You Won't Survive The Night.
111766.description:
Well, it's finally happened. It might have been a plague, some sort of crazy military experiment, or just a freak mutation of some virus; but it doesn't matter, the dead are walking and they are hungry!

ZOMBIES! You Won't Survive The Night is a Zombie-themed card game where you and your friends make up a party of survivors who are doing their best to simply survive. The only problem... They won't! You cannot survive this night! Everyone WILL DIE!!!

While you and your friends are trying to make it, you will go into houses and businesses looking for food and weapons. On occasion, you might just find a Zombie... Of course, dealing with the Zombies in a large group (Up to 10 players) might seem easy at first but eventually you lose people... and when you do, they become Zombies too!

Play doesn't end when you die, your priorities simply change. Once you die and become a Zombie, your goal is simple: Kill all the living and eat their brains!

Will you be the last to survive? Will you be the last Zombie standing? Each play-through will be different in this game of tactics and chance.

111767.name: Das Spiel mit der Krake
111767.description:
Objective: collect/gain as many tiles/chips with quality fishes
as possible
- moving by turns
1. players place their meeples on the board (circle) - youngest one starts
2. turn a tile (fish is shown)- try to catch it by
3. rolling the dice - move your meeple (forewards or backwards)
4. or move the octopus - to block the loot
5. pick up the loot - if accessible
6. flip over another tile/fish - later on 2 tiles at once
7. game ends if no tiles are available
Player with high score (most valuable fishes) wins

111768.name: Kai's Scoundrels
111768.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each cast out from their own societies, Kai's Scoundrels have become a tightly-knit band of smugglers without peer, famed for the transport of illicit wares. The Scoundrels comprise:


"Killer" Kai (N female human magus 7/rogue 1) is the driven young human woman who leads the Scoundrels while dreaming of revenge against her perfidious uncle.
Marrowspitter (CN male gnoll druid 7) is the strangely motivated soul exiled by his people for his strange ways. He is now more than a little bit in love with Kai.
Marra Brandywine (NE female halfling summoner 7/ranger 1) is a decadent halfling determined to wring every last drop of pleasure from life. She lost her parents while young to a cruel, freak twist of fate.
Torn Tusk (NE male half-orc sorcerer [elemental fire]) was exiled from his tribe. This fiery, taciturn mercenary delights in immolating his enemies.
Mercutsio (CE male half-elf rogue 1/bard 7) is a gregarious, self-centred man scorned by both of his parents.
Dread “Captain” LeVar Perilous (CN male human wereshark rogue 3/fighter 4) is a quiet but supremely dangerous former pirate who has lost much of his mind to the curse of lycanthropy.


Kai's Scoundrels presents six fully detailed NPCs that can be used individually or as a group. Perfect as foils to law-abiding PCs, alternatively if your PCs need something illicit, and can find them, Kai's Scoundrels just may be able to help...

Kai's Scoundrels is a Dual Format PDF. The product's ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

111769.name: Deep Caves & Wooded Chasms
111769.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A system-neutral resource for GMs and publishers by Steve Hood.

Throwing a quick dungeon together? As bad at drawing maps as Creighton? Bored of computer generated maps? Don’t want to wave goodbye to half a printer cartridge to print a map? Need a map with that hand-drawn, old-school feel? Then Raging Swan’s Map Packs are for you!

Deep Caves & Wooded Chasms contains three full-page Old School style maps with attendant keys. Usable in personal campaigns without restriction and in commercial projects under very generous conditions Map Packs are an excellent resource for both GMs and publishers.

111770.name: Random Woodland Encounters
111770.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Got barely enough time to prepare the module? Want to include cool, evocative random encounters in your games, but just don’t have the time to prepare them? Bored of pointless random encounters comprising bands of generic monsters that only seem to exist to attack wandering PCs? Then Random Woodland Encounters is for you! Presenting eight ready-to-use random encounters ranging in EL from 1—9 (and 19 stat blocks ranging from CR 1/4—6) all suitable for use in any woodland or forest,

Random Woodland Encounters takes the pressure off the time-crunched GM, enabling him to concentrate on crafting cool, evocative adventures!

Random Woodland Encounters is a Dual Format PDF. The product's ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

111771.description:
Giveaway from the "Spiel 2011 in Essen (Germany)".

Contains the follwing gaming material:

1 "Divine Favor" tile for "Hecate"
2 Hecate columns
6 cloth bags for the 5 player colors and one for hades (expansion)

Note: You need the "Cyclades: Hades" expansion in order to use Hecate.

Divine favors for Hecate:
- Receive for Free: A Priestess card.
- Only once per turn: For 2 GP, place columns on two different islands, regardless of who owns them. These two islands are now connected by an underground passage. This passage can be used to move troops from one of these islands to the other without fleets to carry them. If Hecate comes back into play, you may move either or both columns for 2 GP. Otherwise, these columns stay in place.
111771.name: Cyclades: Hecate

111772.name: TRIBES Anthology I
111772.description:
Publisher's blurb:

TRIBES Anthology I contains full details of the following tribes:


Bleached Skull Gnolls describes these feral denizens of the deep woods and their terrible allies, the bloodspawn treants.
Hobgoblins of the Mailed Fist presents the skilled, disciplined mercenaries of the Mailed Fist and their elder bat mounts.
Kobolds of the Fallen Halls: Two tribes of kobolds, led by their draconic masters, fight for mastery over a long-fallen dwarven hold.
Pazuzu’s Fury: Born of anger and corruption these harpies lure the unsuspecting and weak to gory ends.
Troglodytes of the Tentacled One: Dwelling amid cyclopean ruins buried deep below the Orestone, these degenerate creatures worship an elder horror.


TRIBES Anthology I presents:


32 new feats
22 new spells
11 new magic items
70 stat blocks (CRs 0 -11)
4 new monsters


TRIBES Anthology I is a Dual Format PDF; this ZIP file includes two PDFs, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

111773.name: Psyche: Gamebooks Reborn
111773.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

The Psyche rule book is thirty pages long, printed in colour on high quality 100 gsm paper with a comb spine. The rule book contains the rules, a sample adventure and the various game cards required for the game. The rules take up roughly half the book, the sample adventure roughly the other half whilst the cards pages are printed single sided at the end so they could be removed and used, or photocopied if you wish to preserve the book in pristine condition.

The sample adventure is not intended to replace an actual gamebook; it would probably take about 20 to 30 minutes to play if you did decide to however. Psyche is intended to make use of gamebooks you already own, but if you have none these are availble for mere pennies from online bookstores and auction sites. Check out the Links page for useful gamebook sites. You would also need to provide whatever materials the gamebook you are playing demands - dice, pencils, paper etc.

111774.name: Jorges Bestiarium
111774.description:
Jorges Bestiarium (Jorge's Beastiary) is the first and only monster book for Drakar & Demoner, 6th edition. The book is written largely in-character as a travelling journal with short stories describing an encounter with each beast as an introduction to them.

*From the back of the book (Swedish)*

I flera dagar hade vi trollbundits av den gamle mannens berättelser. Fönsterluckorna på det lilla värdshuset var förseglade och elden sprakade med magins förtrollande kraft. Vinden tjöt och vinterstormen rasade runt husets knutar. Långväga hade vi vandrat för att träffa denna mytomspunne man och lyssna på hans berättelser. Det sades att han hade dragit sig tillbaka från klosterlivet bistra liv sedan många vintrar tillbaka. Han hette Jorge Gronfjard och hade en gång i tiden varit Ovus främsta bestiarie, en sådan som kartlade vår världs bestar och vidunder. Hans kunskaper var outsinliga och alla frågor som vi ställde fick vi svar på. Han lärde oss att de fruktade hrimtursarna bar på en sådan köld att folk dog om de kom nära de väldiga jättarna. Med ivriga ord och brinnande ögon berättade han om hur logedrakarna och jättespindlarna en gång varit bittra fiender. Han berättade om den mörka andekraften som gjorde att de ondskefulla trollen ständigt var på jakt efter nya själar.
Plötsligt tystnade knarret från gungstolen och Jorge slöt sina ögon. Blåsten avtog i styrka och det verkade som om vinden som varit hans livskamrat under så många år nu vördnadsfullt sa adjö. Jorge var hädangången. Kanske for han till den gud som han tillbett under så många år, kanske blev han ett med vinden. När vi senare på kvällen gick igenom den gamle mannens få ägodelar för att skicka dem tillbaka till klostret fann vi en märklig bok. Framsidan pryddes av två kärnfulla ord; Jorges Bestiarium. När vi bläddrade i den fann vi en skatt vars like aldrig hade skådats.

Jorges Bestiarium tar dig djupare in i sagans värld än du någonsin kunnat fantisera om. Nu är Trudvangs alla bestar och dråpare kartlagda. Jorges Bestiarium innehåller storslagna beskrivningar om varje monster och utförliga regler för hur du ska spela dom. I boken hittar du även en ny religion - Hamingjes, den mörka tron - och den första officiella kartan över Trudvang.
Följ med på en resa genom Trudvang! Låt Jorges Bestiarium bli en outsinlig inspirationskälla för dig i dina äventyr och kampanjer.
För att kunna använda Jorges Bestiarium behöver du Drakar och Demoner: Rollspelet.

*From the back of the book (Traslated)*

For many days we had been spellbound by the old mans tales. The window boards in the small inn were locked and the fire cracked with the enchanting power of magic. The wind howled and the winter storm raged outside the house. We had walked a long way to meet this legendary man and hear his stories. It was said he had retired from the harsh life in the cloisters many winters ago. His name was Jorge Gronfjard and had once upon a time been Ovus' best beastiary, a man who cataloged our worlds beasts and creatures. His knowledge was inexhaustible and he answered all our questions. He taught us that the feared Hrimtursar carried such a coldness that men who went to near the enormous giants died. With eager words and sparkling eyes he told us about how the Logedrakar and giant spiders used to be bitter enemies. He told us about the dark spiritual powers tha made the evil trolls keep constantly hunting for new souls.
Suddenly the creaking from the rocking chair ceased and Jorge closed his eyes. The wind ceased and it seemed as if the wind, which had been his life partner for so many years, now said a respectful good bye. Jorge had passed on. Maybe he went to the god he had worshiped for so long, maybe he became one with the wind. When we later that night looked through the old mans few possessions to send them back to the cloister, we found a strange book. The front was graced by two loaded words: Jorge's Beastiary. When we looked through it we found a treasure, the like of we had never seen.

Jorges Bestiarium takes you deeper into the world of fairy tales than you could ever imagine. Now all the beasts of Trudvang are categorized. Jorges Bestiarium contains grand descriptions of each monster and detailed rules for how to play them. In the book you will also find the description of a new religion - Hamingjes, the dark faith - and the first official map of Trudvang.
Come with us on a journey through Trudvang! Let Jorges Bestiarium be an insatiable source of inspiration for you in your scenarios and campaigns.
To use Jorges Bestiarium you will need Drakar & Demoner: Rollspelet.

111775.name: 1830: Chattanooga Promotional Card
111775.description:
A micro-expansion for 1830: Railways & Robber Barons featuring one city, Chattanooga. It is in honour of Mark Derrick's Chattanooga Railgaming Challenge, held every year in Chattanooga.

This expansion adds one city to a less congested corner of the map, giving the players an incentive to build into otherwise quite empty area.

This was a give-away item with purchase in Spiel '11.

111776.description:
The Beggar is a new Action card for Jerusalem.

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

When you play this Action card, place it under one of your squire who's inside one area of the gameboard. That Squire will become a beggar for the rest of the game. Each time an opponent places one (or more) squire inside that area, must give 1 silver Bezant to the beggar.
Note 1: If an opponent plays "Turncoat", the beggar changes his faction!
Note 2: If that squire is removed from the game after a War event or he's killed (the new Assassin card), the card is removed too.
111776.name: Jerusalem: The Beggar

111777.name: Sundered Skies Figure Flats Free Set 1
111777.description:
From publisher blurb:

Figure flats for Ant wildling, Spined Brute Blooded, Oaken Giant & Blood fly swarm.

111778.name: Sundered Skies Figure Flats Free Set 2
111778.description:
From publisher blurb:

Figure flats for Spined Brute Fresh Kill, Damned Soldier, Barnacleape Alternate, Fire Elemental & Black general.

111779.name: Sundered Skies Figure Flats Free Set 3
111779.description:
From publisher blurb:

Figure flats for different colored Dragon Paper Models.

111780.name: Necessary Evil Figure Flats
111780.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 21-page PDF contains 48 unique villains and most every monster you can encounter in this exciting new Savage Setting for Savage Worlds! Not only does it have a whole heap of villains, but you'll also get the V'sori, their troops, and even four vehicle cutouts on the same scale as the other figures!

111781.name: Warlord
111781.description:
User Summary

First century AD, Britain. As the Roman legions push further and further north towards the Scottish border, the Roman and Celtic Gods are also at war, fighting to support their believers. Fearing that too much divine intervention in the affairs of mankind would threaten the fabric of reality, the Gods decide to solve the matter by sending a Roman and a Celt champion to the Otherworlds. The first champion to return to Earth would see his cause prevail.

You are the Warlord, a fierce Celt chieftain. You must find your way back to the real world before the Roman. You'll encounter puzzles, strange places and mythological creatures from the Old Faith. Be wary because the Gods don't like to play by the rules, and the Otherworlds are their home.

Warlord is a text adventure game with graphics. The game include a save feature, and scoring (expressed as a percentage of the maximum possible score).

111782.name: Necessary Evil Explorer's Edition Player's Guide
111782.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our player's guides provide the first section of each of our Savage Settings and let players get all the information they need without revealing any GM secrets. Even better, Players' Guide contain a "Site license" that lets you print a copy for each of your players so they'll have the rules they need for their heroes at their fingertips.

111783.description:
The Pizza Theory: Anchovy Expansion, consisting of a set of 16 anchovy toppings and a rulebook, is used with the Pizza Theory board game to present players with an additional challenge.

In addition to removing the opponents' toppings, each player must now work to keep the anchovies from taking over the pie, too. If all 16 anchovies end up on the pie before any player places his toppings, then everyone loses and the anchovies reign supreme!
111783.name: Pizza Theory: Anchovy Expansion

111784.name: GolFUNator
111784.description:
GolFUNator is a strategic golf board game.Each player begins with the ability of an average Pro Golfer (stats taken from the 2010 PGA Tour Season). The course, Highland Peaks is a ficticional par 72 course.

Players choose the type of shot they will take. Choices range from safe, normal, or all-out from the tee, and safe, middle (of the green) or Go (for the pin) on approach shots. There are also other choices during play. On putts from the fringe and distances over 25', the player may choose 'GO' or 'LAG'. Almost anything that can happen in real golf, can happen in GolFUNator. 6 times per round, if the player hits an errant shot (trouble) he may choose to use one of his/her 6 'LUCK' cards. The results will be either good, bad, or no luck at all.
A player can get HOT by getting 2 birdies in a row. He/she may also become COLD with 2 bogeys in a row.

The game comes with a 14x14" HD laminated cardstock 2-sided board, 2 10-sided dice, 5 decks of cards, markers, scoresheets and instructions.

111786.name: Extra Impetus 4
111786.description:
The fourth supplement for Impetus. Including a campaign game based on Alexander the Great conquest, a couple of tutorials, errata and optional rules, and the following official army lists:

THE AGE OF HOPLITES
Athens (2 lists)
Thebes
Sparta
Other cities (Corinthus, Megara, Argos)
Ionic Greeks
Magna Graecia
Thessaly
Thracians
Early Achemenid Persians
Illyrians

ALEXANDER THE GREAT AND THE SUCCESSORS
Early Macedonians
Alexander macedoanians
Alexander Empire
Later Achemenid Persians
Classical Indians
Maurya Empire
Achean League
Aetolian League
Early Ptolemaic
Middle Ptolemaic
Later Ptolemaic
Graeco Bactrian Kingdom
Indo Greek Kingdom
Galatians
Early Seleucids
Scythians
Early Macedonian Successors
Alcetas and Minor Successors
Eumenes
Antigonus Monophthalmus
Demetrius
Lysimachos

ROME AND THE MEDITERRANEAN SEA
Middle Republican Romans
Carthaginians
Iberian and Lusitanians
Celtiberians
Gauls
Numidians
Later Numidians
Later Macedonians
Later Seleucids

111787.name: The St. Franks Football Game
111787.description:
An extraordinary game.
The game is played on any reasonable sized table. 2, 4 or 6 players can play.

This must be a forerunner of football games like Subbuteo. But, instead of little footballers that you flick, in this game you where the football boots. The diagram illustrates this rather well. You kick the ball literally with your boot-encased finger.

The rules allow for free kicks, throw-ins and penalties.

There is a warning that your boot fingers must be on the table at all times, so that should be very friendly with six players, three a side!

111788.name: Joe Blade
111788.description:
User Summary

Joe Blade is a sideview run-and-gun. The back of the box says:

THE STORY
In an ambitious raid a gang of vicious terrorists led by the infamous Crax Bloodfinger have kidnapped six world leaders, demanding thirty billion dollars ransom for their safe release. Of course, the governments concerned have refused to pay and as the deadline draws nigh they decide to take the only course of action left open to them: send in Joe Blade-Joe Blade - trained in a Tibetan monastery. Mean, tough and fearless ,his very name strikes fear into the cold hearts of every gangster, assassin and drug baron.

THE MISSION
You are Joe Blade.... Armed only with a light semi-automatic machine gun, you must infiltrate Bloodfinger's massive fortified HQ and rescue the hostages. Bloodfinger's base is guarded heavily by his private uniformed army and underworld henchmen, contact with which will drain your strength. The stronghold is also protected by 6 booby-trapped explosive devices, all of which must be activated, giving you twenty minutes to complete your task before Bloodfinger's lair blows up taking you with it. To activate these explosives you have to rearrange the access code into alphabetical order using left, right and fire to swap the letters. Scattered around are various pieces of equipment and supplies that may be used to your advantage.

111789.description: In Play with the coloured balls a lot of disorder has been created, the winner is the first to gather his balls back together, but to be able to do that one must answer questions, do gymnastics with the dog and solve puzzles. Each player has a collecting table and in his turn rolls the die and moves. Depending on the colour of the animal track a ball chip is turned over and one takes a card from the thus determined card stack. The rabbit poses a riddle, fun or logic question, the parrot a knowledge question and the dog sets a movement or a pantomime task. For a correct solution the player receives the chip for his table.
111789.name: 3 mit Kopf & Pfote: Fit, pfiffig, schlau

111790.name: Joe Blade II
111790.description:
User Summary

Second installment in the Joe Blade series of games. This time it's a beat'em up game. Joe Blade must rid London's streets of criminals and help defenseless citizens. In addition to the action sequences, the game includes a puzzles that the player must solve to pick up citizens.

The game is won when the player has defeated at least 100 criminals and rescued 20 persons in less than 10 minutes.

111791.name: Joe Blade III
111791.description:
User Summary

Third (and last published) installment in the Joe Blade series of games.

Joe Blade is once more up against Crax Bloodfinger. The criminal has kidnapped six TV and music celebrities and is holding them hostage in his 30 storey high rise, the Crax Plaza. Joe must infiltrate the building, find the hostages, activate six bombs and find and arrest Crax Bloodfinger.

Like the other games in the series, Joe Blade 3 uses a side-view display. The character explore rooms, picking up ammunition, grenades, keys and discs. The game also includes number-based puzzles the player must solve in order to open doors, hack security systems and arrest Crax.

111792.name: Tour of Darkness Player's Guide
111792.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Player's Guide for Weird Wars: Tour of Darkness contains the first 35 pages of the book, including all the Edges and Hindrances, rules for character creation, complete equipment lists for America, French, and Vietnamese forces, and the setting rules (including resupply and the all-important fire support).

111793.name: Space Racer
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC 3" Floppy Disk edition
111793.description:
User Summary

Space Racer is a futuristic jetbike race. The player controls a futuristic bike which hovers over an energy line on the ground. The player must reach the finish line before running out of time. The bike can be steered in all directions, but if it gets too far from the energy line it looses speed and energy, and eventually crashes on the ground.

There are other, computer-controlled contestants. They can be shot down or pushed into an obstacle and of course they'll try to do the same to the player.

111794.name: CastleControl
111794.description:
Players take turns rolling to move around the board where they can buy properties and permanent upgrades, defeat monsters and avoid traps, and duel each other for dominance.
Monsters and Traps are on High and Low Level Dungeon cards which players can choose from when they land on a Dungeon tile. After a successful roll which can be modified by upgrades, you can win gold pieces (money). Unsuccessful rolls reduce your hit points. If your hit points reach zero, you're out of the game.
Properties can be purchased and upgraded with housing, affecting the amount of rent opponents must pay when they land on your property. If you collect enough properties of certain types, you can control the castle in that territory, which greatly increases rent.
The right to own properties can also be dueled over by rolling against each other using various modifiers like housing and castles playing a large role in winning or losing.
A player will be deemed the winner when they are the last player with hit points and/or money.

111795.name: 50 Fathoms Figure Flats
111795.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 21-page PDF contains player characters and most every monster you can encounter in this exciting new Savage Setting for Savage Worlds! You'll find heroes and hags, pirates and privateers, monkapes, razorwing swarms, zombies, and even the Walking Gods of Torath-Ka - the Savage Land!

rpg: The Savage World of Solomon Kane
111796.name: Gothic Figure Flats
111796.description:
From publisher blurb:

This amazing set of Figure Flats contains paper miniatures useful for all our "Gothic" settings, including Pirates of the Spanish Main, 50 Fathoms, The Savage World of Solomon Kane, Deadlands: Reloaded, and Rippers.

111797.name: Necessary Evil
111797.description:
From Introduction:

In Necessary Evil, a band of aliens lured the world’s superheroes into a cunning trap and killed or imprisoned the vast majority of them. The player characters are the only enhanced beings left to save the planet — supervillains! As the alien overlords’ policy is to kill anyone exhibiting paranormal powers, the only option open for such individuals is fight or flight! You
can guess which option most villains choose…

111799.description:
In December 1956, paroled rebel Fidel Castro returned to Cuba to launch his revolution with virtually no political base and—after a disastrous initial encounter with government forces—a total of just 12 men. Two years later, through masterful propaganda and factional maneuver, Castro, his brother Raúl, and iconic revolutionary Che Guevara had united disparate guerrillas and exploited Cubans’ deep opposition to their dictator Fulgencio Batista y Zaldívar. Castro’s takeover of the country became a model for Leftist insurgency.

Castro’s Insurgency

Following up on GMT Games’ Andean Abyss about insurgency in modern Colombia, the next volume in the COIN Series, Cuba Libre, takes 1 to 4 players into the Cuban Revolution. Castro’s “26 July Movement” must expand from its bases in the Sierra Maestra mountains to fight its way to Havana. Meanwhile, anti-communist student groups, urban guerrillas, and expatriates try to de-stabilize the Batista regime from inside and out, while trying not to pave the way for a new dictatorship under Castro. Batista’s Government must maintain steam to counter the twin insurgency, while managing two benefactors: its fragile US Alliance and its corrupting Syndicate skim. And in the midst of the turmoil, Meyer Lansky and his Syndicate bosses will jockey to keep their Cuban gangster paradise alive.

COIN Series, Volume II

Cuba Libre will be easy to learn for Andean Abyss players—both volumes share the same innovative GMT COIN Series system. Like Volume I, Cuba Libre is equally playable solitaire or by multiple players up to 4—and with a shorter time to completion than Andean Abyss. But Cuba Libre’s situation and strategic challenges will be new. A deck of 48 fresh events brings 1950s Cuba to life and includes …

• The Twelve: The first wave’s escape to the Sierra Maestra—inspirational legend or harbinger of defeat?
• El Che and Raúl: Brilliant in the field, or bungling hostage-takers?
• Operation Fisherman: Can the rebels pull off a second invasion?
• General Strike: Urban disruption or rebel embarrassment?
• Radio Rebelde: Are the masses tuning in, or just the Army direction finders?
• Pact of Caracas: Can the rebels unite?
• Armored Cars: Mobile striking power, but in whose hands?
• Rolando Masferrer: Brutal pro-government tactics—will they help or hurt?
• Fat Butcher: Can the Mob’s enforcer protect its casinos?
• Sinatra: Frankie’s Havana show a boom or bust, and who collects?
… and much more.

New twists match the COIN Series system to the situation in 1950s Cuba:

• It’s the insurgents who build lasting capabilities, while the Government is limited to fleeting bursts of momentum.
• The Syndicate’s bases are Casinos—expensive to build, but so important to Cuba no army will destroy them.
• Syndicate special activities include calling in the “muscle” of Government troops and police to protect mob assets.
• Stacks of Syndicate cash awaiting launder can fall in anyone’s hands—even the corrupt Government’s.
• The Government has its own terror tactic—reprisals—and can skim a portion of Syndicate profits.
• The eroding US Alliance with Batista overshadows all Government actions, not just through aid levels but also through the day-to-day ability of troops and police to operate.
• Even if Batista flees, the struggle may not end—the counterrevolutionary government may even become stronger!

Multiplayer, 2-Player, Solitaire

Cuba Libre provides up to 4 players with contrasting roles and overlapping victory conditions for rich diplomatic interaction. For 2- or 3-player games, players can represent alliances of factions, or the game system can control non-player factions . Or a single player as the Cuban Revolutionaries can attempt to topple Batista and seize power for themselves. The non-player sides will fight one another as well as the players, but too much power in the hands of any one of them will mean player defeat.

More COIN Series Volumes to Come

Andean Abyss and now Cuba Libre present a game system on modern insurgency readily adaptable to other conflicts, particularly those featuring the interaction of many sides (thus the name COunterINsurgency Series). A rich and under-represented history of guerrilla warfare beckons, as modern insurgency offers virtually unlimited, under-gamed topics for the COIN Series. Volume III is A Distant Plain—Insurgency in Afghanistan. Volume IV is Fire in the Lake—Insurgency in Vietnam.
111799.name: Cuba Libre
boardgamepodcastepisode: 13. Devon Dice Guilds, Thrones and Assassins
1P 047 - Cuba Libre
DJ34: Entrevista a Chechu Nieto
