The Good, The Board and The Delayed: Episode 68 “Timo Multamäki interview”
Travis Gets Heavy - Ep. 1 - The COIN Series
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80
Wild Weasel 3

111800.name: Flicking through the Ages
111800.description:
'Flicking through the Ages' is a 2-player dexterity civilization game created as part of the NaGaDeMon contest during the month of November 2011. Aside from the obvious Through the Ages nod, FttA claims Flicochet, Tumblin Dice, Breakout and the classic carnival game of knocking over milk bottles as its primary pedigree.

FttA aims to deliver the civilization 'feel' to a dexterity game playable in under 30 minutes and assembled from easy to find materials. It combines five completely different minigames into a timeless struggle for cultural supremacy! Players balance their actions by using population discs in the following ways:

1. Gather resources by flicking your disc down a platform decreasing in size with increased return for increased risk.
2. Research new technologies by flicking your disc at one of four stacks of available technologies arranged like a breakout game and taking the block you strike. Once obtained, players need to choose whether or not to add the technology to their list of abilities or to trade in the block to increase their population
3. Declare war on the other player's civilization by flicking your disc at their researched technologies stacked in a pyramid. Knock your opponent's blocks down to steal population, technology or colonies
4. Vie for colonies by flicking your disc closer to the colony disc than your opponents
5. Construct Wonders of the World by stacking resource cubes on a disc and sliding it along a path symbolizing the shape of the building without letting one fall

NOTES:

Construction of 'Flicking Through the Ages' requires:
1 set of Jenga-style blocks
1 set (2 colors) of 'bakelite'-style backgammon discs or other discs of roughly 1.25" diameter that flick reasonably well and are heavy enough to impact a tower of Jenga blocks enough to fall over
1 set of the rules including the 'colony' and 'technology' sticker sets to be applied (or taped) to the above components

111801.name: i See it!
111801.description: i See it! - Is a fast-action Electronic word trivia game, where questions light up in a LED display Globe. There are 12 categories and 6 different versions of the game. The game includes more than 7200 challenges. Players try to see what the answer is and hit their buzzer to stop the word as it comes up, then they have to say what it is by seeing it first!

111802.name: 8-Bit Invaders
111802.description:
In 8-Bit Invaders, you are defending your home planet from an onslaught of alien invaders. Each turn, you roll six dice and use them to attack the advancing horde; then the aliens march inexorably forward. If you can kill all of the invaders before they land, you win; otherwise, you die.

Designed for the Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

111803.name: Little MEMO
111803.description: A memorization game for kids aged 2.5 to 5, the game comes with 9 cute soft plastic animals & insects, flower tokens, and a little box. The players are shown all the animals, then while they close their eyes one animal is hidden inside the box. The players then have to take a guess which animal was hidden in the box. The one who's right gets a flower token. First player to earn five tokens wins!

111804.name: TigerShark
111804.description:
User Summary

TigerShark is a game where the player leads a futuristic American attack submarine against hordes of enemy forces. The TigerShark vehicle can dive underwater to move around, but primarily fights on the surface of the water. Weapons include a high-powered machine gun, torpedoes, and missiles.

111805.name: Potz Blitz
111805.description:
Objective: be the first to get rid of all your cards

1. each player receives 5 cards (randomly) - other cards will be placed in a stack on the back onto the board
2. turn the top card and place it according the illustrated letter on the board
3a. player left to the starting may place a card with a letter, part of the previous placed card
3b. same player may place a new/additional card on the board if the leading letter is part of previous placed card (3a)
3c. player may continue according above mentioned rule
4. if he/she can't place an additional card next player may
act in similar way, but if no card can be played a new/additional card must be taken
5. if you empty your hand - you win
golden chip is used to mark the card last played
game was published for two different target groups
children and addults - see editions/images

111807.description:
Quick Overview

Ant Assault is quick and easy to learn card game that puts each player in charge of their own ant nest. They must send parties of ants out to forage, all the while defending themselves and their nest from assault by the other players.

Details
Players can experiment with many types of ant, including scouts who root out the enemy and find new resources, honey pot ants who store food, soldier ants who fight, and the dreaded bullet ants who lead assaults.
Enter the world of an ant nest, and dominate the garden!
111807.name: Ant Assault

111808.name: Wieże Żywiołów
111808.description:
User's summary:

an adventure for players on level 4-5 for use in any d20 fantasy setting.

111809.name: Miecze zdrady
111809.description:
User's summary:

an adventure for players on level 6-7 for use in any d20 fantasy setting.

111810.description:
Objective: be the first to arrive at your tent with all 4 parts of a golden mask
players are acting by turns, using 2 dice
1 die has to be used for your meeple, the other to move a lion
players dig for gold - better: parts of a mask
each part buried four times - but you must find 4 matching parts
you may dug, block (with lions), steal whatever brings you closer to the goal to leave the others behind...
111810.name: Das Geheimnis der Pyramide

111811.name: Flugreisespiel
111811.description:
Objective: be the 1st to bring 3 of your 4 planes down to the airport
merely a 'Roll and move' game with one exception:
the action 'Positionswechsel' which means 'change of position'
the more players the better because if the board is 'crowded' this action can be worked out easily
==> even if your plane(s) trail behind there's a chance to win

111812.name: Tatou (Issue 17 - Jan 1994)
111812.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:

- L'Héraldique, Heraldry in Pendragon (1st - 5th Editions)
- La Vengeance du Bâtard, scenario for Pendragon (1st - 5th Editions)
- La Cité de Venise, the town of Venice, for Hawkmoon
- Mutants, Psioniques et Autres Clones, mutation and psychic powers for Cyberpunk 2020
- Qui Sème des Mutants, scenario for Cyberpunk 2020
- Pour le Septième du Septième de tes Enfants, scenario for RuneQuest (3rd Edition)

111813.name: Operation Iceberg: Battle of Okinawa
111813.description:
In the summer of 1945 the United States had a firm grasp of the Pacific Theater. Japans once mighty fleet was all but shattered and unable to support any garrisoned island against an U.S. attack. With Iwo Jima taken earlier in the year the U.S. had an island to land damaged bombers that were hitting the mainland island. To launch an invasion of the main island of Japan the U.S. would need a bigger stepping stone to launch from; Okinawa was the answer.

This is a 2 player game set on the island of Okinawa and surrounding waters that recreates the battle between U.S. and Japanese forces during World War 2. The basic rules follow the concepts laid out in Axis & Allies, but combat resolution has been modified to a D12 system. The game can be played to 10 turns or 20 depending on the length of time desired; and victory is determined by the number of airbases held or carriers destroyed. The map is divided into areas that are controlled by the players' armies represented by the plastic Axis & Allies pieces.

The rules incorporate a number of new features to the Axis & Allies style of play including terrain effects, country specific units, and all new unit types including flame tanks and LCMs.

111816.name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexenprüfung Hextrankkunde
111816.description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Hextrankkunde tests dexterity. You receive one straw and 5 ingredient chips and try so suck up a chip with the straw and place it into the cauldron. The first player to place all his chips into the cauldron wins the game.

111817.name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexenprüfung Krötenhopsen
111817.description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Krötenhopsen again tests dexterity. You have one try per toad to snip it into the pond with yor finger. Each toad ending up in the pond, totally or in part, scores 1 point. If the toad touches the water lily, the score is 2 points. The player with the majority of points after 3 rounds wins the game.

111818.name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexenprüfung Spinnentanz
111818.description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Spinnentanz is also a test on dexterity. Two players stand opposite to each other and have a spider fastened to their waistband in the back. Both try simultaneously to place their spider on the card. The first player to do so scores 1 point. When everyone has player has played against everybody else, the player with the highest score wins.

111819.name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexenprüfung Hexwissen
111819.description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Hexwissen tests knowledge. The referee poses the questions and gives three answers - the first player to call out the correct answer receives the card. The first player who collects four cards wins the game.

111820.name: Steeltown: The Outsider Chronicles, Volume One
111820.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You are part of Project: Outsider, a crack team of specialists that explores alternate realities. Your first stop is "Steeltown," a dirty little place where technology spirals out of control and the bottom has dropped out of morality.

"Steeltown" is made for use with SOL: The Omniversal Roleplaying System. The 2nd edition rules are included, complete with guidelines for creating your own Outsider personnel.

111821.name: Der Fette Pinguin
111821.description:
The Fat Penguin is an ice-breaker. In the game, players take turns to ask a question of the others. Players secretly choose their answer (red/no or green/yes). Then the asking player has to guess individually what the other players answered for themselves. If the player is correct, then its penguin advances.

The questions varies from everyday-life tendencies and preferences, to life/death and ethical dilemmas, and funny/dirty questions. E.g.: "Have you in the past year used someone elses toothbrush?", "Would you rather give up your mom's love (green) og the respect of your friends (red)?", "What is more unattractive: Too self-confident (green) or too shy (red)?", "Routined sex three times a week (green) or exciting sex once every third week (red)?"

The game is intended as an ice-breaker at parties. The drinking-game variant makes the players take a shot of booze/beer if they are right or wrong.

The game is published in German "Der Fette Pinguin", in English "The Fat Penguin" and in Danish "Den Fede Pingvin". There is also a smartphone App version of the game (available in Danish for iPhone, and soon in English and German and also for Android).

111822.name: Macius: Hurra, heute ist Maskenball!
111822.description: There are 16 characters from the stories of the little king Macius in this game. Each character consists of four cards (hat, head, belly and legs). The players roll the dice and try to collect all cards and whoever has the most complete figures at the end of the game wins.

111823.name: Crafted
111823.description:
User Summary

Crafted is a minecraft style open-world game where everything is made of blocks.

111824.description: Frank and Buster give a party so big, that no one can really keep an eye on all the guests. Who can find the combinations of guests first? One player rolls the dice and all players simultaneously look for the characters rolled. They can be on one or more cards, but must be adjacent do each other, diagonal combinations do not count. For a correct combination a player receives all tiles in the combination, for an error one looses a card. When the draw pile is finished the player with the most cards wins.
111824.name: Die Koala Brüder: Tempo, Tempo, Freunde!

111826.description:
Experience the Sengoku Jidai battles of two opposing Eastern and Western forces, with 15 glorious scenarios, in Way of the Samurai.

Notice: This Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. To use it, you must own a copy of:

• Ancient Battles Deluxe
• Ancient Battles Deluxe Expansion Kit 5: Design Your Own

Game Data:

Complexity: 4 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 6 on a 9 scale
Time scale: Each Game Turn equals 45 minutes
Unit scale: Dozens to hundreds of men, beasts and equipment

Game Components:

• 80 color, 5/8" square counters
• 1 Rules sheet
• 15 Original, glorious custom-designed scenarios

Okehazama, 1560 AD
4th Kawanakajima, 1561 AD
The Anagawa, 1570 AD
Mikata-Ga-Hara, 1573 AD
Nagashino, 1575 AD
Tedorigawa, 1577 AD
Yamazaki, 1582 AD
Shizugatake, 1583 AD
Komaki, 1584 AD
Nagakute, 1584 AD
Hitotoribashi, 1585 AD
Hetsugigawa, 1586 AD
Surigehara, 1589 AD
Sekigahara, 1600 AD
Tennoji, 1615 AD
111826.name: Ancient Battles Deluxe Expansion Kit 5.1: Way of the Samurai

111827.description:
A mini-expansion consisting of 10 cards that introduces "Badges" to the game.

A Badge can be drawn at random by a Unit that obtains a "Battle Cry" RWB. The Badges have a permanent effect for the Unit (much like a Specialist), usually helping its Unit obtain RWB or Awards more easily.

"Badges" also comes with a Badge-related Award (the "Efficiency Medal") and with rules (printed on 2 rule cards).

This expansion was given as a thank you gift to all the supporters of D-Day Dice's 2011 Kickstarter campaign, and will become available later in 2012 as an exclusive on Valley Games' website.
111827.name: D-Day Dice: Badges
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

111828.name: Make 10 and 20
111828.description: Invented by a Korean dad who wanted to help his kids learn how to master and conquer math. Throughout the game, you simply add up 3 tiles to make a sum of "10," 3 and 4 tiles to make a sum of "20." Each color is played separately and the black tiles are joker tiles. The goal of the game is to get rid of your tiles first!

111829.name: Traveller Compendium 2
111829.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This second volume of the Traveller Compendiums collates all the most popular articles that have appeared in Signs & Portents over the past year, and presents them for the tabletop! Inside you will find new careers, new ships, adventures, patrons, advice on running games, new equipment, and much more!
Compendium 2 contains the following articles and adventures;
- Annic Nova
- Otherworld Blues
- Old Acquaintances
- The Thing In The Pit
- Death Station
- Of Dust Spice And Dew Claws
- Spinward Fenderbender
- A Festive Occasion
- Rescue On Ruie
- A Helping Hand
- Old Flames
- A Friend In Need
- Balancing The Books
- The Flying Money Pit
- Mass Battles
- Apologies For Absence
- Give The Bank A Fighting Chance
- Parallel Dimensions
- Availability
- Susag
- A Gallery Of Outsiders
- Space Bazaar
- Xenologist

111830.description:
You and your friends are going on a photo safari! To see as many animals as possible, you will have to plan your trip well. Whoever visits the most areas and takes the best photographs will be the safari champion!

In DiceAFARI, you select a route to visit on the animal-shaped map by rolling the custom dice strategically – but choose wisely because routes are limited and other players can revisit the areas you select. Be sure to take a photo of an animal you see before someone else does. Once the entire map has been visited, points are scored for sets of photos taken and areas most recently visited. The player with the most points wins!
111830.name: DiceAFARI
boardgamepodcastepisode: DiceAFARI
OBG 81: Gaming Through Disney World
Session Impressions: DiceAFARI

111832.name: BRAHMA Force: The Assault on Beltlogger 9
111832.description:
From the back of the box

BRAHMA: Bipedal Robotic Assault Heavy Mechanized Armor.

Mankind is faced with annihilation when the vengeful Dionsio Vega seizes control of the colony, Beltlogger 9. Only you can infiltrate the space fortress and save humanity. Strap yourself into the cockpit of a heavy mech where split-second decisions mean the difference between life and death!

111833.name: Road Rash: Jailbreak
111833.description:
User Summary

Road Rash: Jailbreak builds on earlier Road Rash titles by allowing the player to race courses while bashing other riders and trying to stay a step ahead of the law. In this game, there are three different characters to choose from, all with different strengths and weaknesses. The goal of the main mode in the game is to amass victories and gain power-ups such as special weapons to eventually become the leader of your gang and spring a friend out of jail. There is another mode called "Five-O" where the player instead takes on the role of a police officer trying to bust as many biker punks as he can.

111834.name: Rommel in Africa
111834.description:
From the application's "About" file

This game is a classic hex and counter game converted for Android.

There is a map of North Africa divided into hexes.

Each hex can be controled by one of two players: One player represents the Italian (and later the German) forces, while the other represents the British Empire forces.

Each player has a number of combat formations (units) which they may move around the map in an attempt to win the war.

Units have a name designation at the top, a symbol representing the unit type in the middle, a combat strength in the lower left and a movement rate in the lower right.

Victory can be achieved by capturing more objectives than the enemy - a major victory if you capture them all: Objectives depend on the scenario, Allied objectives are shown by green circles, Axis by yellow, while a joint objective is both colors.

The Full version has eight scenarios:

1. Italian invasion 1940.
2. Rommel arrives 1941 and storms across the desert, but cannot take Tobruk.
3. Operation Crusader - Rommel is defeated and Tobruk relieved.
4. Gazala - Rommel's masterpiece.
5. Mersa Matruh - The pursuit of the 8th Army into Egypt.
6. First Alamein - Auchinlek halts Rommel.
7. Alam Halfa - A desperate last throw of the dice.
8. Second Alamein - Montgomery annihilates Rommel.

All games can be played 2 player or as either side against the computer/phone/tablet.

The demo version has 1. and 3. above and is free.

111835.name: Korean War
111835.description:
From the application's "About" file

This game is a classic hex and counter wargame converted for Android.

There is a map of Korean peninsula divided into hexes.

Each hex can be controlled by one of two players: One player represents the North Korean (and Chinese) forces, while the other represents the South Korean (and U.N.) forces. Each player has a number of combat formations (units) which they may move around the map in an attempt to win the war.

Units have a name designation at the top, a symbol representing the unit type in the middle, a combat strength in the lower left and a movement rate in the lower right.

Victory can be achieved by:

North Korea/China: Capture all ports/cities in South Korea.

South Korea/UN: Capture all ports/cities and supply areas in North Korea.

The game ends after 30 turns if the above is not achieved.

111836.name: Exerbeat
111836.description:
User Summary

Exerbeat is a fitness game in which players follow along with on-screen dance, aerobics, boxing, or karate instructors. Colored arrows appear on the screen during different parts of each exercise, and the game tracks how well players follow the arrows using their Wii Remotes. Like We Cheer, the game has an option for players to use two Wiimotes simultaneously, one in each hand. New exercise routines are unlocked as players progress.

111837.name: Yugoslavia 1941
111837.description:
From the application's "About" file

This game is a classic hex and counter wargame converted for Android, covering the Axis invasion of Yugoslavia in 1941.

A game for two players on Axis player and one Yugoslav player. Alternatively, one player may play either side, while the computer plays the opposition.

The playing area is a map of Yugoslavia and surrounding areas split into hexes, which control movement and ownership of terrain.

The objective of the Axis player is to capture the five cities: Zagreb, Sarajevo, Dubrovnik, Skopje and Belgrade as quickly as possible. The Yugoslav player must stop them.

111838.name: Minions
111838.description:
Minions brings the classic web-based style game called 'Tower Defense' to your table top. Two criminal masterminds send waves of minions to destroy the enemy HQ. To keep the minions away, each player deploys a variety of towers to eliminate those pesky minions. The first player to sneak three minions through their enemy's defensive perimeter succeeds in destroying the enemy HQ and winning the game.

Minions uses a variable map system allowing different paths each time you play. Machine Guns, Cannons, Missiles, and Death Rays abound to frustrate the Minions' attempts at destruction.

111839.description:
Power Trip is a thrilling, fast-paced card game that can change directions at any time. Players race to get rid of all their cards first by attempting to match or beat the cards played by others, or by playing a Clear or Power Trip card to clear the discard pile. The first player to do so becomes the Ruler. Be the first player to become Ruler three times to WIN THE GAME. Play out of turn to complete four of a kind and use Action and Rule cards to squash your competition.

Easily score your Power Trip games and keep players on the edge of their seats by generating new and existing rule cards with the iPhone and Android Power Trip app.
111839.name: Power Trip Card Game

111840.name: Pathways (Issue 9 - Nov 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Chronicles of Storm, Volume II: The Jade Renku
Legendary V: Eastern and Exotic Weapons
The Sinking: Ascension of the Prophet
The Blackness of Darkness: Priests of Loss and Night
111840.description: Horror-themed Pathways roleplaying, fiction by Matt Banach, creatures by Creighton Broadhurst, and an interview with Scott Gable of Zombie Sky Press.

111841.description:
Top Promoter is a new card game for 3-5 players in which players try to make more money than their opponents. By putting their fighters in the best position for the big payday, players increase their chances of victory!

Each player has his own deck of 15 fighters and five action cards. Each round, players simultaneously play a fighter face-down, then reveal them at the same time. These cards get played into locations that are in the center of the table following certain rules. Once a location has three fights, the fights are resolved through dice.

Each fighter has a number of dice he rolls that can be modified with action cards or by fighting in his home location. The number of dice can range from 1-7 dice, and whoever rolls the single highest die wins! However, some fighters have a signature move that will guarantee victory!

Top Promoter is a light game that inspires trash talking and cheering as the underdog takes down the favorite!
111841.name: Top Promoter
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 4: Star Wars: Imperial Assault, Neuroshima Hex Contest, Castles of Mad King Ludwig and Medieval Night

111842.name: Graey
111842.description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players that adds a twist to the classic black vs. white setup: grey pieces that belong equally to both players.

The game mechanism revolves around enclosure (either partial or full) of other, single pieces on a square grid board. Surrounded pieces can be either removed from play, replaced with upgraded pieces, or can cause extra turns or even a win, depending on the degree of enclosure (i.e. being surrounded by either 6, 7, or 8 pieces belonging to the player) and also the color of central piece being enclosed.

A turn consists of a player either placing or moving a piece, and then acting out consequences if their move results in one or more enclosure situations. In standard game play, the color of the piece to be played (either the player's own color or grey) is decided by the flip of a fair coin, but the game can also be played without that element of chance by simply alternating between the two.

The game ends either when a player causes a piece to be entirely enclosed with pieces belonging to them filling all 8 surrounding squares (in which case they are the winner), or in the event that no open spaces remain on the board (in which case the player with the most pieces of their specific color is the winner.)

The game is both fun for beginners and yet dynamic enough to also engage experienced strategists.

111843.name: Hack Slash Crawl
111843.description:
User Summary

A dungeon crawler with randomly generated maps. You can choose from a number of races, and classes. Upgrade your stats as you level, and choose what weapons and armor rings and boots to wear, each with different attributes, and some giving you magic spells.

111844.name: Heavy Weapons
111844.description:
User Summary

An overhead view, 360 degree shootemup. You have a spaceship, and try to destroy the other ships while keeping yourself safe. Collect money to upgrade weapons, you can have three weapons equipped simultaneously.

111845.name: Hedgehog Launch
111845.description:
User Summary

Launch your hedgehog to get as much money as you can. Get money by grabbing the spheres, or hitting launch pads that will give you a bit more boost on the way back down. Score more money for the higher you go, and the longer your turn lasts. Spend the money on a number of upgrades to assist your quest.

111846.description:
Viva la ResistANTS! is an abstract boardgame. Main game mechanics includes area controll, set collection and 'press your luck'. It combines American and European styles of boardgaming design. The game has a unique setting. The forces of Resistance of Ants led by the mysterious Serg Ant try to help the civilians survive under the occupation of enemy forces, who perfidiously attacked the peaceful republic of ants. Now you must fight for your freedom. Let's say together: Viva la ResistANTS!

Each player has a detachment of 10 ants. Each turn the player can send 2 of them to the field to participate in a special mission or withdraw 1-3 of them. At the start of the game the playfield is generated randomly. If 1 or more ants get status missing in action, players should shuffle the tiles of the playfield and generate it randomly again. Other ants return to players. The ants get status missing in action if a card from alert deck with the appropriate colour is revealed for the second time. One card from alert deck is revealed every time each player takes a turn. If the same colour is revealed for the third time the alert deck must be shuffled. If it must be shuffled for the second time, the game is over. The player who gets more victory points becomes a winner. In case of a tie, the winner is the player who retained more ants.
111846.name: Viva la ResistANTS!

111848.name: The Alien
111848.description:
User Summary

Loosely based on the movie of the same name, you must find the alien aboard your ship and use the right strategy to defeat it. Requires joystick or paddle for orders inputs.

111850.name: LÖWENZAHN Quiz-Spiel
111850.description:
The players have to collect 8 knowledge chips of every color. The chips are rewarded for answering one of 2200 questions out of different areas
During player's turn die is rolled; he/she may move into any direction, but not vice versa; occupied spaces may be crossed.
Appropriate card is drawn, die is used to pick a question - if the answer is correct, player may add an additional turn - moving again. You pick a chip if you find a correct answer for a space on the outer circle.

111851.name: Motocross Maniacs
111851.description:
From the back of the box:

MOTOCROSS MANIACS™


Are you crazy enough to qualify as a Motocross Maniac?

This is pure insanity. And to take the checkered flag, you'll need sheer intensity to throttle past hundreds of obstacles, including the Head Spinning Loop and the Sky Riding Ramp. You'll also need precision skills to refuel with Nitro Turbo Boosts that'll power you to victory.

There are 8 championship tracks and 3 Ultra-challenging levels (Rookie, World Class and Daredevil) to choose from. You can even race against the clock or computer. Or attach your Video Link™, and spit some mud in the face of a friend.

So get down and dirty in an off-road rad race where speed and courage are the difference between popping wheelies and biting the dust.


Play against the computer. Or attach the Video Link and play against a friend.

From Wikipedia:
The game's concept is quite simple; the player controls a motorcycle moving one way horizontally, much like in a platform game. When a level has been completed within its time limit, the player starts on the next.

The player's control over the motorcycle allows moving the front wheel upwards or downwards, allowing for jumps over obstacles and rotating stunts when in the air. If the player lands incorrectly, the rider will fall off his bike and climb back on it. This results in the main cause of time loss within the game.

The motorbike also has the ability to use a limited amount of "Nitros" which provide a short speed boost. This allows for large jumps and can be necessary for making loops.

Additional sets of nitros can be picked up within a level (marked as a large "N"). Other power-ups in the game include more time (marked as "T"), more speed (marked as "S", continues until the player crashes) and special tires (marked as "R", also continues until the player crashes).

Source: Wikipedia, "Motocross Maniacs", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111852.name: SQUIIZ!
111852.description:
A fast and fun party game based on questions and dexterity!

A good materials inside the box. You must Slam the plastic hammers on a category to answer at the questions!
During each round the reader in turn must take an Action card and follow what it says: for example, you must read the question and talk with a "french accent" or cover an eye with your hand.
Moreover, the player reads the question without reading the category; who knows the answer must slam the hammer on a board in the space of the correct category!

A fast party game from 3 to 24 players!

111853.name: Le Iene
111853.description:
Based on a popoular TV Show aired in Italy from 12 years continuously; the "Iene" are journalists who report on investigations of fraud and political problems.

In the Game "Le IENE" each player has a secret rule: he can be a "Iena" or a Cheater.

The Cheaters characters are: the doctor, the medium, the manufacturer and the politician.

In his turn the player can:
- choose an area in the city and gain money for all the cheaters pawns in that area.
- move a character pawns to one area from another and take objects.
- accuse another player to be a Cheater.
- interview another player, so he can have more information about his identity.

There will not possible to gain money or take objects when a "Iena" pawns is in that area. Infact the cheaters can make illagal traffic of money when the "Iene" aren't there for an interview!

At the end, if the "Iene" players found the right association between players-cheaters they win: otherwise, players gain/loose money according to their accusations, objects and interviews and the player with most money will be the winner.

111854.name: Trasformat
111854.description:
Based on a TV Quiz Show aired in Italy.

There are more than 300 different cards with a transformed or masked image that represents a famous person, an animal, an object, a monument, a painting or a sculpture.

The active player must to recognize the subject of the pic and gain points.

Fun little game, with 4 different variants, based on good observation and quick thinking.

111855.description: In Lumacorsa, a family card game about snail-racing, players have to bet on the snails involved in the race. A player can alter the speed of the snails by playing cards from his hand.
111855.name: Lumacorsa

111856.name: Wer hat die Kokosnuss geklaut?
111856.description:
Objective: collect as many quality coconuts as possible
- moving by turns -
1. Preparation of the game - place all coconut tiles face down (good and bad) on dedicated fields
2. roll the die and move - if the die shows the tiger move back to your starting place
3. if you step on a coconut - pick it up and check
4. if you land on an opponent's meeple - steal a coconut and put her/him in the middle of the board (palm tree)
5. if there are only 4 or less coconuts on the board use a rolled '4' to move AND steal a coconut from a player

Die Spielidee: 2 - 4 Affen rasen auf die Lichtung und jagen nach Kokosnüssen. Dabei passiert eine ganze Menge. Der Tiger ist auch unterwegs und den mögen die Affen nicht. Wer zum Schluss die meisten Kokosnüsse (geklaut) hat, ist nicht unbedingt Sieger, denn es gibt auch faule Nüsse.

111857.name: Turbo-Wörter-Quiz
111857.description:
Objective: be the first to reach the finish line
- moving by turns -
1. place the meeples on the starting position
2. turn the spinner and draw a question card
3. there is one minute left to find an appropriate answer - starting with the letter the spinner is pointing on
4. if you fail roll the die - if the number matches with correspondent letter number you may move, too
5. if spinner points at a symbol act as described

111858.description:
You are a solitary hero fighting to survive in a world once afflicted by ancient wars between Orcs, Elves, Humans and Angels and other Races (included in the expansions Cripta, Covo, Alchimista).

It does not matter if you are a Mage, a Paladin or a Warrior (or another Class contained in Cripta, Covo, Alchimista expansions); all you have to do is to get the most powerful equipment you can find, such as handcrafted swords and shields, spells or what remains of the fire guns and hi-tech weapons produced by a now-gone civilisation.

Defend yourself and defeat your opponents. Are you ready to fight?

Warage is the ultimate turn-based strategic card game: role play, strategy and deck building merged all together for endless adventures.
111858.name: Warage: Starter Set

111860.name: Fermat Math Game
111860.description: A mathematical game for 2 to 4 players. Each player has 9 balls in his game colour. The playing field is 6x6 and numbered from 1 to 36. If it is your turn, you have one minute (egg timer) to roll 3 regular dice and arrange them in a formula with the four basic mathematical operations. The result is where you put your ball. The target space must be unoccupied. If you can not create a formula in one minute for a free space your turn ends. If you achieve 3 or more own balls in a row you get VP. If you get five own balls in a row the game ends. The first to have no more balls ends the game also. Player with the most points wins.

111861.description:
Following up on their successful Kickstarter campaign to get their game, Cards Against Humanity, professionally published, the creators are back with a card expansion that adds more hilarity for us horrible people that like to play.

In this card game, players take turns being the Card Czar, which means they will read a black question card or a fill-in-the-blank statement card. The other players will select a white answer card from the 10 in their hand that they think best or most humorously fits the question/statement. The Card Czar will then shuffle the answers and choose the one they like best, with that answer's owner receiving the black card as his "awesome point" for winning the round.

Once a player has at least one awesome point, they can wager an awesome point when giving a white answer card in order to throw in a second answer card, giving that player a better chance to be chosen. The winner of the round will receive the original black card as well as any that are wagered in that round.

Play continues until a pre-determined score is reached, or until everyone is tired from laughing so hard.

This expansion adds 20 black question/statement cards and 80 white answer cards to the deck as well as 12 blank cards for players to come up with their own card ideas.
111861.name: Cards Against Humanity: First Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cards Against Humanity – First Expansion
Episode Twenty-Seven: Mad Against Humanity

rpgissuearticle: The Social Implications of Magic: Evil Essence Base Lists
The Social Implications of Magic: Sorcerer Base Lists

rpgissuearticle: Dwarven Magic Items for High-Level Campaigns
Kiri Kin Tha's Advanced Metaphysical and Supernatural Principles
My Death Is Near... I'm So Cold
The Social Implications of Magic: Open Mentalism Base Lists
111863.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

111864.name: Total verdreht!
111864.description:
Objective: collect as many precious treasurers as possible & try to block other players
- moving by turns -
1. shuffle treasure cards and put 3 of them upside down on the board - place all the track tiles,too
2. roll the die - move your meeple into direction of a treasure
3. at the end of your turn you may turn a track tile at 90° degree to the left or right (blocking or preparing your route)
4. if you roll a 'wand' you may exchange one of your treasures for another player's one (different values)
5. if all treasures a collected count up the values printed on the tile

111865.name: The Guild Companion (Apr 2009)
rpgissuearticle: The Social Implications of Magic: Closed Mentalism Base Lists
111865.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
111866.description:
In Rise!, players race to be the first to construct three towers on the growing game board, moving workers to and fro to keep the towers rising and the opponent befuddled.

To set up, place 12 hexagonal tiles in a dogbone shape as specified in the rulebook, then place one token for each player on their starting locations. On a turn, a player takes two actions (possibly the same action twice) from this list of options:


Place a land tile adjacent to any existing tile.
Place a worker adjacent to any of your workers already on the game board.
Move one of your workers to an adjacent empty space.
Jump an opponent's worker and land on an empty space, removing that worker from play.
Remove two of your workers from the board to remove an opponent's worker from any space.
Remove two of your workers from the board to place one of your workers in any empty space.
Remove one of your tower layers from the board.


If at any time during play you have a circle of six of your workers surrounding an empty space, place the first layer of one of your towers in that space. Your ring of workers must remain in place for two additional turns for the remaining two layers to be added to the tower; if your ring is disrupted, you can complete it later to continue the tower-building. If you completely surround an opponent's tower, you can remove the top level of that tower from the board.

In addition to building three complete towers, a player can also win by eliminating all of the opponent's workers from the game board.
111866.name: Rise!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 27 - Rise
Funding the Dream Kickstarter Podcast Ep 16 S1:E16

rpgissuearticle: Quick and Dirty MERP Character Creation
United Clansmen of Warriors and Huscarls

rpgissuearticle: Arcane Congress of the Secret Mysteries of Merlyna
The Social Implications of Magic: Lay Healer Base Lists

rpgissuearticle: The Social Implications of Magic: Mentalist Base Lists

111871.name: Tremblex
111871.description:
In Shake Shake Tower – this game's original name – players start the game with eight 3D curved polyomino pieces in a single color, then take turns placing them on a swiveling, seesaw-style platform. Gravity pulls the platform and pieces from side to side as the tower rises, so players might have a tough time adding a piece to the stack – especially since each level must be filled before players can play on top of other bricks. If a player can't legally play, she must skip her turn, so play strategically to block others while leaving yourself room to grow!

If you knock pieces off the tower, you keep them on the side, losing one point for each brick in such a piece. When a player plays her final piece, the game ends. Players then score one point for each brick of theirs visible from a top-down view of the tower. Whoever has the high score wins.

Tremblex, a revised version of Shake Shake Tower, uses the same pieces and nearly the same scoring method, but players are free to place pieces as they wish on the tower – with one small exception that drives play in a different direction. Each piece you place must touch one of your pieces already in play; if all of your pieces have been covered by other players, then you're forced to sit out until someone else knocks pieces off the tower! Once this happens, all players are back in the game. The game ends when a player places her final piece, and players tally their scores, earning one point for each brick showing from a top-down view of the tower, losing one point for each brick in pieces knocked off the tower, and collecting a three point bonus if their piece is highest up in the tower.

Tremblex includes variant rules as well, such as a cooperative mode in which players try to complete the tower with no holes and a two-player game in which opponents place pieces only on their half of the platform, trying to scale higher than the other player in order to win.

111878.name: Quer durch Europa
111878.description:
Objective: be the first to visit 5 capital cities within Europe
- moving by turn -
1st choose side of the map (geographical or political)
2nd draw card to find starting position
3rd draw additional 5 cards and 'form' a route
4th roll the die and move your meeple
5th you may use cards (max 2 =) ship and plane tickets instead of your die
5th if the roll shows a symbol draw an action card and proceed
as described

111879.name: Hedgehog Launch 2
111879.description:
User Summary

Launch your hedgehog into space! Try to launch as high as possible, stay up as long as possible, and collect money. Hitting the platforms allows you to gain an additional boost. Upgrade many attributes to assist your launches. This second game in the series features many more upgrade possibilities.

111880.name: Fenrir's Fury
111880.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the frozen wasteland of the Norselands, a gentle druid returned to his village after a successful hunt. Upon his return he found his village reduced to a smoldering ruin, his home ransacked, and his family slaughtered. All love died that day, and his soul became a rock of ice bent upon revenge. Thus begins the fury of the rabid wolf shaman Fenrir.

This Sidetrek Adventure is set in the great viking north and is suitable for 4-5 6th level characters. It includes skill encounter rules for viking lie-tells and cross country travel as well as 6 custom battlemaps suitable for printing.

Sidetrek Adventures are short flavorful adventures that can be inserted into an ongoing game with very little effort.

111881.name: Shrine of the Risen
111881.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to the Shrine of the Risen, an ancient holy site to the Ascended God. Though the Risen himself has perished his temples and shrines remain. It is at the Shrine of the Risen that the demon Tenzekel seeks the knowledge to ascend to divinity himself.

Sidetrek Encounters are single location adventures designed to be placed into any campaign.

User note: This was KromeDragon Games' item for Free RPG Day 2011, and thus is available as a free download.

111882.name: The Bloody Cauldron
111882.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zu-Zu is a different sort of girl that is always finding trouble. Escort Zu-Zu to a city in crisis, Zagrev, where children have gone missing. The desperate mothers of the missing children turn to the Heroes for help. Find the lost children, save a damsel in distress, garner favor with the gods and earn the right to be called heroes.

For four 4th level characters, this adventure includes six custom-created print quality maps.

Sidetrek Adventures are short flavorful adventures that can be inserted into an ongoing game with very little effort.

111883.name: The Ring
111883.description:
UNPUBLISHED PRODUCT




it appears this Item will never be published
this Item has been moved to (Unpublished Products)
there should be no product images submitted to this entry




Publisher's blurb:

A Sidetrek Adventure for 4-5 4th level characters.

Sidetrek Adventures are short flavorful adventures that can be inserted into an ongoing game with very little effort.

111884.name: The Forsaken Tomb
111884.description:
UNPUBLISHED PRODUCT




it appears this Item will never be published
this Item has been moved to (Unpublished Products)
there should be no product images submitted to this entry




Publisher's blurb:

An Adventure Delve for 4-5 6th level characters.

Delve into the depths of the parched desert land of Khemet and dare the pharaoh's curse. In the tomb of the ancient pharaoh Setnahkt there is more than treasure buried with the dead. Defeat the guardians of the tomb, plunder the ancient riches, but you must vanquish Pharaoh Setnahkt himself if you want to live.

111885.name: Temple of the Locust Lord
111885.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Temple of the Locust Lord is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible module designed for four 1st level characters that uses the medium XP advancement track. This module is designed to be played in any campaign setting with a mountain containing a megadungeon.

Temple of the Locust Lord pits the characters against the minions of the demon known as the Locust Lord.

The Purple Mountain series is designed to be a classic mega-dungeon. You know the kind...

It doesn't have much in the way of plot or even make a lot of sense from level to level but it will have: pathways to the subterranean realms, prisons for eldritch demons, ancient ruins, lost civilizations, legendary weapons, unexplainable or lost magic, mines, slave pits, elemental nodes, water-filled passages, mazes, one-way doors (heck secret doors), traps, haunted levels, classic monsters (ropers, trapper, mimics, otyughs [especially otyughs], owlbears), dragons, monsters too big to have ever fit down those hallways, and artifacts!

A classic mega-dungeon with everything wrong and right about it!

111886.name: 80 Awesome Feats and 2 Crappy Ones
111886.description:
Publisher's blurb:

80 Awesome Feats ... and 2 Crappy Ones is a new collection of feat for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Within the electronic pages of this tome you will find a host of general, combat and metamagic feats with a couple of teamwork and psionic feats. Additionally, there is a dozen totem feats for characters with a more mutualistic relationship with the environment.

80 Awesome Feats ... and 2 Crappy Ones builds upon concepts and ideas put forward in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, Advanced Player's Guide and Ultimate Magic.

111887.name: Good Little Children Never Grow Up (Pathfinder)
111887.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Everybody in Hedgebird knows that the old DeMay orphanage is haunted, but that did not stop the Perseville family from moving to town and buying the place. Nor did it stop the Tarnak boys from venturing inside. Now the children are trapped inside, and to get them out the heroes must confront terrible ghosts from the orphanage’s past.

Good Little Children Never Grow Up is a horror themed adventure for five characters levels 4-5. You can run it either as a one shot adventure or as part of a larger campaign.

It features:


3 Combat Encounters
1 New Template
1 New Haunt
2 New Magic Items


NOTE: This is the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game version of the adventure. "Good Little Children" is also available in a 4E compatible version.

111888.name: Intrepid Expeditions: The Island of Life
111888.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Destination: Adventure!

Legend, myth, and rumor tell of a mysterious and secluded tropical island by the name of Kawa’lea. This lush paradise is said to be home to an amazing variety of plants and animals not found anywhere else in the world. Far more exciting, though, it’s said that the island is steeped in powerful life magic, and that it can have curious effects on those who land upon its shores. Some say that it is the location of the mythical fountain of eternal youth. Others say that the island’s powers return the dead to life.

But there are darker ruins about this mythical island of life. Some say that it twists and corrupts all who travel there, transforming them into feral and misshapen monsters. Others say that its jungles hold ancient and terrible creatures, great predators whose footsteps cause the very ground to quake. Still other rumors hint at a dark secret somewhere in the heart of the island.

Intrepid Expeditions: The Island of Life provides a GM with background information on the island of Kawa’lea. It gives general descriptions of the island as a whole, including its curious and unique magical effects. It also provides more in-depth descriptions of each of the island’s five regions, detailing various items of interest, such as magical landmarks, ancient ruins, potential allies and deadly enemies. The book also details a number of new creatures native to the island. A separate player’s guide provides background information on the island to whet players’ appetites for adventure, as well as a prestige class that taps into Kawa’lea’s unique magical properties.

If you’re looking for a fun place for your players to explore, and ideas to spark your own adventure through a fantastic terrain like nowhere your party has ever gone before, this is the book for you!

111889.name: Superbike World Championship
111889.description:
Press Release

REDWOOD CITY, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 3, 1999--Electronic Arts(TM) (Nasdaq:ERTS), the world's largest interactive entertainment software company, today announced that it has shipped Superbike World Championship for the PC.

It is the latest franchise for the industry-leading EA SPORTS(TM) brand. Electronic Arts has the exclusive license to the SBK Superbike World Championship.

Superbike World Championship features blistering-fast 3D racing for the PC. This high-end motorcycle racing simulation allows gamers to push precision built Superbikes from Ducati, Honda, Kawasaki, Suzuki and Yamaha to the absolute limits on the long straightaways of international tracks like Germany's Hockenheim Raceway. Racers can also tune the bike to assist in perfecting cornering skills on the many contoured Superbike tracks like the curvaceous Laguna Seca Raceway in California.

"Superbike World Championship is an excellent addition to the EA SPORTS line-up," said Marcus Iremonger, executive producer of Superbike World Championship. "This game raises the bar to new levels for hard-core motorcycle simulations. EA SPORTS' Superbike gives you the opportunity to pull on your leathers and prove that you can handle over 150 horsepower on the toughest international raceways against the very best riders."

Superbike World Championship offers different modes of play that enable gamers of all skill levels to enjoy the experience. Those new to PC racing will enjoy the Action mode which includes a computer assisted artificial intelligence that forgives many rookie mistakes.

Die-hard gamers will be challenged by the demanding and totally authentic realism of the Simulation mode. The Sim mode challenges gamers to master all aspects of Superbike racing. To become a Superbike champion in Sim mode, one must have superior race skills and strategies on 12 of the toughest road courses in the world.

To win, the racer must analyze telemetric data to identify and implement the optimal Superbike setup, and learn to handle the bike in traffic and variable weather conditions.

In an effort to make the game as realistic as possible, the Superbike production team enlisted the help of the 1998 World Champion Ducati Team. The team's input was critical in the development and implementation of the Superbike telemetry and physics model used in the game.

Superbike World Championship is fully compatible with a variety of major Direct 3D(TM) accelerator cards including 3Dfx VooDoo2(TM), which greatly enhance the 3D presentation of the richly textures track environments, riders, and motorcycles.

There are 12 official International Superbike tracks in the game, including Phillip Island (Australia), Donington (United Kingdom), Monza (Italy), Brands Hatch (United Kingdom), Assen (Holland), Sugo (Japan), Misano (Italy), Hockenheim (Germany), Laguna Seca (USA), A1 Ring (Austria), Albecete (Spain), and Sentul (Indonesia). All are accurately reproduced from topographical and geometric data.

Gameplayers can race as any of the 18 following SBK Superbike icons: Carl Fogarty, John Kocinski, Akira Yanagawa, Pierofrancesco Chili, Pierogiorgio Bontempi, Noriyuki Haga, Jochen Schmidt, Simon Crafar, James Whitham, Mike Hale, Pere Riba Cabana, Andreas Meklau, Aaron Slight, Scott Russell, Neil Hodgson, Colin Edwards II, Igor Jermanb or James Haydon.

EA SPORTS is the leading interactive sports software brand in the world. Its top-selling titles include FIFA 99, John Madden Football(TM), NHL(R) Hockey, Knockout Kings(TM), NBA Live Basketball, Tiger Woods PGA TOUR(R) Golf, Triple Play Baseball(TM) and NASCAR(R) 99.

Electronic Arts, headquartered in Redwood City, is the world's leading interactive entertainment software company. Founded in 1982, Electronic Arts posted revenues of more than $1.1 billion for calendar 1998. The company develops, publishes and distributes software worldwide for personal computers and advanced entertainment systems.

111890.description:
Fury, a game of fantasy warfare, brings the Manoeuvre game system to the lands of the West. Knights and Orcs fight against Dragons and Dwarves to decide the outcome of the 2nd War of the West. Fury takes the bones of Manoeuvre and builds a game that has more of everything you like in the original. More and varied types of movement such as flight and teleportation, more combats in a turn each with their own deadly styles, and devastating spells that can turn the tides of war in your favor. Your ability to control the Fury of the battlefield will determine your fate.

Fury includes armies for each of the nations of the west including; the Elves of the Woodland Realm, The Dwarves of the Kingdom of Zikkim, The Theocracy of Tayanna, The Nik’tmarg a loose conglomeration of humanoids and savage men, Badari the desert empire, The Republic of Toren, Medis the feudal lands of the wizards and Tireisis feared by all as the domain of the Necromancer. In addition Fury adds in many small nations and mercenary bands that can swing a battle in your favor.

The map boards now include mountains and desert in addition to the basic land types introduced in Manoeuvre. Other additions are territorial objectives, spells, various methods of Attack and Defense. The game includes more and varied types of Movement, expanded leader capabilities and involvement. The card mix also allows more combat from every unit through the use of generic nationality cards that can be utilized by any unit on your side. Fury turns the orderly Napoleonic battlefield on its head and populates it with Goblins, Zealots and Zombies ready to fight for their cause.

For many more details on each nation as well as the mercenary units, visit Jeff Horger's design blog at: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/blog/857/fury

Components:

36 Terrain Tiles
8 Nations consisting of 9 Units and 49 Cards each
23 Mercenary Units with 3 Cards each
2 Sheets of 1” Counters
Rules
8 Nation-Specific Player Aids
2 Mercenary/Terrain Player Aids
Dice (4d6, 4d8, 4d10)
Playing Time is 30-60 minutes
Complexity= 3
Solo Rating= 1
111890.name: Fury of Harrows

111891.description:
Crayon-rails style game in Italy, including the islands of Sicily and Sardinia. This is a pick-up-and-deliver affair in which players draw railroad tracks on the map on which they run their trains to satisfy demand cards. Connecting all of the country's major cities is required. Upgrading one's train abilities is possible. Victory is achieved by being first to achieve a set amount of cash on hand.

Innovations: staggered ferry pricing, public-locking rules standard, demand cards sorted by value and no commodity chips.

Cards available from ArtsCow or for direct print.
111891.name: Italian Rails

111892.name: Fear Unlimited Arena
111892.description:
User Summary

You are trying to defeat demons, and you can become a demon yourself when your stats are high enough. This game is a "tribute" to Devil May Cry series. You have access to long range guns, and short range swords. You can jump and take evasive action. Try to live as long as you can, and score the most points. Combo attacks are also available.

111893.name: Fear Unlimited 2: Issue 1
111893.description:
User Summary

Fight against hordes of demons. Get past each level to unlock more levels. Use your sword or your gun, or look for combos! This game is a "tribute" to Devil May Cry.

111894.description:
Objective: get as many precious ingredients as possible - avoid those with lemons
1 each player receives a (blank) pizza board and a 'fork' in his own colour
2 ingredients are placed on the board - sunny side up (some have a printed lemon on the backside)
3 player rolls the die and must move his fork along the board in a straight line - but not transverse - and may make one 90° turn
4 if there is an ingredient, take it and put it on your pizza
do not show other players the backside of your ingredient; leave your fork where you took the ingredient
5 if someone lands on a fork he may snitch 3 ingredients from the fork's owner and put the fork on the pizza (starting place)
6 game ends until all ingredients are picked
111894.name: Pizza Stibizza

111895.name: Fear Unlimited: Issue 2
111895.description:
User Summary

The second game in the Fear Unlimited series. This series is a "tribute" to Devil May Cry. It features two additional weapons and improved graphics. Try to fight off the demons with your guns and your sword.

111896.name: Fear Unlimited: Full Edit
111896.description:
User Summary

This game is a "tribute" to Devil May Cry. Attempt to fight off as many demons as you can using your sword and gun. You can also use combo-attacks, and unleash your own inner demon to assist you in the mayhem. This game features more cartoonish graphics than the other games in this series.

111897.name: Forgotten Futures II: The Log of the Astronef
rpgissuearticle: Möge der Dampf mit Euch sein
111897.description:
Introduction
A comprehensive guide to the exploration of the Solar System in 1900 AD. Based on George Griffith's Stories Of Other Worlds, it contains six stories, the illustrations from their original publication, a worldbook taking the story forward to 1920, a spaceship design spreadsheet, five adventures, and more. Forgotten Futures II contains ASCII text files, grey scale .GIF files, and spreadsheet templates. Now incorporates the novelisation, A Honeymoon In Space and its extra illustrations.

111898.name: Forgotten Futures III: George E. Challenger's Mysterious World
rpgissuearticle: Möge der Dampf mit Euch sein
111898.description:
Introduction
Adventures with Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's scientific hero, including the full text of The Lost World, The Poison Belt, When The World Screamed, The Land Of Mist, The Horror Of The Heights, and The Disintegration Machine, a worldbook, four adventures, a wargames scenario, full games rules and templates, 34 monochrome .GIF files, 4 Lotus 123 templates, etc.
Note: Now includes all illustrations from the original publication of The Lost World in The Strand Magazine

111899.name: Forgotten Futures IV: The Carnacki Cylinders
rpgissuearticle: Möge der Dampf mit Euch sein
111899.description:
Introduction
Horror and the supernatural in Edwardian England, including the original text and illustrations for William Hope Hodgson's Carnacki The Ghost Finder, a worldbook with rules for magic and the Ab-natural, three adventures and two long outlines, a story-telling card game, and much more.

111900.name: F.E.A.R.: Combat
111900.description:
F.E.A.R. Combat is the complete multiplayer component of F.E.A.R. (First Encounter Assault Recon). F.E.A.R. Combat includes all the updates, all the new official maps and new official modes released for F.E.A.R. multiplayer in one free downloadable file. F.E.A.R. Combat users will be able to play against the owners of the retail version of F.E.A.R. as well as other F.E.A.R. Combat users.

Features include:
• 10 Multiplayer Game Modes
• 19 Multiplayer Maps
• 12 different weapons
• Punkbuster™ anti-cheat support
• The capability to download user generated content

Source: The Game Website.

111901.name: Field Command
111901.description:
User Summary

A strategy game, using adventure format. You will be given several options on how to achieve your objectives for each stage. Making poor choices will end in loss of life for your soldiers, and can result in poor positioning or sub-optimal choices as the action continues. Making good choices will allow you to continue with more soldiers, and give you better options. Complete each objective satisfactorily to continue.

111902.name: Field Command Two
111902.description:
User Summary

The second game in the Field Command series takes you to the Iraq war. This is also primarily an adventure game, with the twist that in some sections the game becomes a shooter (either first or third person). There are also some choices that must be made in a time limit. Once again you will be offered several choices, and must make the best one given the situation.

111903.name: Field Command Three
111903.description:
User Summary

Take on the role of the Nez Perce in the nineteenth century at war with the Americans. Most of the game is played with a menu system wherein you choose from several options, but there are also mini-games in which you take a more direct role in the action.

111904.name: Age Past Main Rulebook
111904.description:
From Introduction:

Age Past is an RPG that has been designed around an RPG gaming experience. The rules have been crafted to give players a deep experience without having to sacrifice choice. There are many way to play and there are nearly infinite builds allowing a player to craft her character to be exactly what she wants. Design efficiency is the key; keeping and utilizing rules that allow the system to be deep enough that players can shape, yet not so deep that the rules are dozens of pages deep.

Age Past is also designed to be modifiable. There are many optional rules that can help set the proper depth of complexity for the Game Master (GM). Play with anything you want and make new stuff up! If something seems too powerful then tone it back and if something seems weak then make it stronger. The GM and players can choose the level of intensity when playing.

Many gamers enjoy intricate investigation scenarios. Some love brutal combat. Others enjoy evenly matched and tough combat with big boss fights. Others love political intrigue. In Age Past all of these scenarios are possible. The GM and players can craft a gaming experience that is of their own choosing. Age Past has minion and henchman combat rules, so if you like, you can sit back and let your underlings duke it out for you... or you can get in there and sever some heads. The combat system is simple yet is broken up into actions. Characters can spend actions to make things happen so combat becomes more dynamic than just move and attack. A typical combat includes attacking, moving, counter attacking, and moving again. There are many abilities that can be used right along with attacking.

The magic system in Age Past was designed to give those who like casting magic the ability to use it in any circumstance that is listed above. Casters have access to powerful damaging, mind altering, and mystery solving spells. Any spell can be cast at any time as often as you like so there are not any limitations except your caster’s stamina. Utility spells are build right in with all the other spells so there’s no need to try to choose between the “fire blast” and “open lock” spells.

The skill system has been completely rethought and designed to help keep character’s balanced and every ability in the game is paid for in build points known as BP’s. This means that the more powerful the ability the more it costs to add it to your character. While character balance is perfect, it keeps everyone in line so that no one gets left behind.

Terres is the world that Age Past takes place in. It is made up of different spheres. A sphere is an area of land or continent separated by water, mountains, or crevasses. Each sphere is attached to its neighbor, but travel between the two is impossible or extremely difficult. Hence, natural life in each sphere as grown and developed differently over the many thousands of years.

Time and gravity on Terres is constant unless altered by a magic spell or Gods’ intervention. Characters will become hungry and need to sleep, and they will age at a standard rate. Different realms have different physical rules and will act differently from how Terres works. Realms are areas that lay on top of or coincident with each other. Travel between realms is extremely difficult and is only done by strong magic. In some realms characters will not grow hungry or age, while others will speed up time for the travelers or slow it down in relation to Terres. Not surprisingly, the races and cultures can live exclusively in these realms will be very strange to those who live outside.

111905.description:
Objective: make most of your money manipulating the running-in
- moving by turns -
1 each player draws a hidden card which proposes a different running-in of the 5 (coloured) horses
2 each player rolls 3 coloured dice - colours on top designate the horses to be moved during this turn - 3, 2 and 1 space
by choice of the active player
3 if a die shows a horseshoe - free choice
4 obstacles and/or special positions are going to change/modify results
5 if all horses have crossed the finish line there is a check/comparison how many positions are matching with the running-in proposal on your card
6 after collecting points players will run 2 additional rounds
111905.name: Pferde-Rallye

111906.name: A Song of Ice and Fire Chronicle Starter
rpg: A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying
111906.description:
Publisher Blurb:

To get the full experience of A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying, you must play a chronicle and engage in the Game of Thrones. With a setting as rich as Westeros though, where do you begin? The answer is the Chronicle Starter. This useful sourcebook details six sample houses, any of which can be run by the Player Characters. Choose your house and allegiance (Arryn, Baratheon, Frey, Lannister Stark, or Tully) or make up your own house and make allies or enemies of those provided. The Chronicle Starter also includes a complete scenario so you can kick off your adventures right away. Get ready to make your mark on the Seven Kingdoms!

111907.name: Final Ninja
111907.description:
User Summary

You are a ninja, in fact the greatest ninja master of all time. Your special suit gives you the power to become invisible. You can also throw shuriken, and have access to a grappling rope. Fight those who oppose you.

111908.name: Final Ninja Zero
111908.description:
User Summary

This game is a prequel to Final Ninja. You control a ninja, fresh out of ninja academy on a corporate espionage mission. You can throw shurikens, use your wall jump, and have access to a grappling hook, you also have stealth technology in your ninja suit.

111909.name: Flea
111909.description:
User Summary

Guide your flea through the levels, avoid spikes, and collect coins. Everytime you die you lose 50 points, each coin is worth ten and completing a level is worth 100. The game keeps track of your score, even below 0 points. You can move left and right, climb walls, and can jump even in the midst of another jump.

111910.name: Flea 1.5
111910.description:
User Summary

Guide your flea through the levels! Avoid the spikes, climb the walls, jump continuously, grab coins for points and get through levels. Passing a level gets you 100 points, dying costs you 50 points. This game features new levels, though some are repeats of Flea.

111911.name: A Midsummer Night's Scheme
111911.description:
From the introduction:

A group of faeries has been exiled from the Faerie Court by Oberon for excessive connections to the mortal world, but Titania has persuaded him to give them one last chance to return to the Faerie Realm. They have until dawn to prove that they are not emotionally attached to a mortal, through pranks and games.

Unfortunately for the faeries, each of them *is* attached to a mortal, and the best way to “disprove” the accusation is to target the very mortal they are suspected [rightly] of caring for with the cleverest—or cruelest—pranks they can.

This is a roleplaying game for one Storyguide and 2 or more players. You will also need at least a dozen d8s and pencils and paper. If you wish, there is a character sheet at the end of this document that you can print out (one for each player).

111912.name: Globe Records
111912.description:
Author's summary:

A roleplaying game of Shakespearean characters transplanted to an
early-'90s-style prime-time soap opera.

111914.name: Flaming Zombooka
111914.description:
User Summary

A zombie themed puzzler game. You must defeat all the zombies in each level with your bazooka. Either directly by shooting the zombies, or indirectly by interacting with the physical elements in each level. You have a limited number of rockets, so shoot carefully. Bonus points are scored for better performance, and levels can be replayed at leisure.

111915.name: Daughters of Exile
111915.description:
Author's summary:

A roleplaying game of love, duty and rebellion.

111916.name: Flaming Zombooka 2
111916.description:
User Summary

Kill the zombies with your bazooka. Once again you can either shoot them, or shoot physical objects around the level to kill the zombies. This game features new levels, ranks how well you did on each level by stars (one, two or three) and there is improved graphics and sound.

111917.name: Unreal Anthology
111917.description:
User Summary

A collection of four games from the Unreal series/franchise. They are:

Unreal,
Unreal II: The Awakening,
Unreal Tournament, and
Unreal Tournament 2004.

111918.name: Flaming Zombooka 2: Level Pack
111918.description:
User Summary

Kill off all the zombies with your bazooka. Either kill the zombies directly by shooting them, or shoot the physical objects around the level. Avoid killing the humans, and shoot brains for bonus points.

111919.name: Memory Challenge: Super Mario Edition
111919.description:
From the publisher:

"Power-Up the World’s most popular matching game – MEMORY!

Challenge yourself to the classic game of Memory with a Super Mario™ twist. Turn over cards and find their match. Pick up an Item Card to add more fun and challenge. The player with the most matches wins!

Game includes: 52 Character Cards, 20 Item Cards and Rules."

Item cards distinguish this version of Memory from the original by giving players special powers, as items do in the Mario series of video games. For example, by picking up the matched Yoshi's Egg cards, a player can take the matched Yoshi cards away from another player. The Super Star cards protect a player from other item card actions.

111920.name: Grand Theft Auto V
videogamehonor: 2012 Golden Joystick Most Wanted Game Next Year Winner
2012 Spike Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner
2013 Global Game Awards Best Action Game of the Year Winner
2013 Global Game Awards Best Open World Game of the Year Winner
